text: Blessed is the man that does not walk in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stand in the way of sinners, nor sit in the seat of the scornful.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his delight is in the law of the LORD, and in his law he meditates day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that brings forth its fruit in its season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatever he does shall prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ungodly are not so but are like the chaff which the wind drives away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD knows the way of the righteous, but the way of the ungodly shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do the Gentiles rage, and the peoples imagine a vain thing?
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD and against his anointed, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: let us break their bands asunder and cast away their cords from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that sits in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he shall speak unto them in his wrath and trouble them in his sore displeasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I have set my king upon Zion, the mountain of my holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will declare the decree; the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day I have begotten thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the Gentiles for thine inheritance and unto the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand now therefore, O ye kings: receive chastening, ye judges of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiss the Son lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way when his wrath is kindled in a little while. Blessed are all those that put their trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! Many are they that rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many who say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory and the lifter up of my head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he answered me out of the mountain of his holiness. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I laid me down and slept; I awaked, for the LORD sustained me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people that have set themselves against me round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God, for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the jawbone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salvation belongs unto the LORD; thy blessing shall be upon thy people. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness; thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after the lie? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself; the LORD will hear when I call unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand in awe, and sin not; meditate in your heart upon your bed, and desist. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many that say, Who will show us any good? LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put gladness in my heart in the time that their grain and their wine multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will both lay me down in peace and sleep: for thou only, O LORD, dost make me to be confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ear to my words, O LORD; consider my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God, for unto thee will I pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; early will I present myself unto thee and wait.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art not a God that loves wickedness; neither shall one who is evil dwell with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foolish (those who are governed by carnal thoughts or desires) shall not stand in thy sight; thou dost hate all workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt destroy those that speak lies: the LORD will abominate the bloody and deceitful man.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear I will worship toward thy holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is no uprightness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare them guilty, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out for the multitude of their rebellions; for they have rebelled against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all those that put their trust in thee shall rejoice: they shall ever be in jubilee, for thou shalt cover them; and all that love thy name shall be joyful in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak; O LORD, heal me, for my bones are troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is also greatly troubled; but thou, O LORD, how long?
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in Sheol who shall give thee thanks?
speaker: Narrator

text: I am weary with my groaning; all the night I flood my bed; I water my couch with my tears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxes old because of all mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity, for the LORD has heard the voice of my weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has heard my supplication; the LORD has received my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: All my enemies shall be ashamed; they shall be sorely troubled: they shall turn back and be ashamed suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD my God, in thee I have put my trust: save me from all those that persecute me, and deliver me
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest they take my soul, as a lion dismembers his prey when there is none to deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD my God, if I have done this: if there is iniquity in my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: if I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me, then let my persecutor escape without retribution.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; let him tread down my life upon the earth and lay my honour in the dust. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger; lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake the judgment in my favour that thou hast commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about, for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness and according to the integrity that is in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let wickedness consume the wicked; but establish the just: for the righteous God is he who tries the hearts and kidneys.
speaker: Narrator

text: My shield is in God, he who saves the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is he who judges the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he does not turn, he will whet his sword; he has bent his bow and made it ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has also prepared for him the weapons of death; he ordains his arrows against the persecutors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he travails with iniquity and has conceived of his own work and brought forth falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a pit and deepened it and shall fall into the ditch which he made.
speaker: Narrator

text: His work shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD our Lord, how great is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy praise above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou might still the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;
speaker: Narrator

text: what is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou dost visit him?
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels and hast crowned him with glory and beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:
speaker: Narrator

text: all sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;
speaker: Narrator

text: The birds of the heavens, and the fish of the sea, and whatever passes through the paths of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD our Lord, how great is thy name in all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will tell of all thy marvellous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High
speaker: Narrator

text: because my enemies are turned back; they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast accomplished my judgment and my cause; thou didst sit in the throne judging according to righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast reprehended the Gentiles, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and the cities that thou hast destroyed; their memorial is perished with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD shall endure for ever; he has prepared his throne for judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall judge the peoples in uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD also will be a refuge to the humble, a refuge for the time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, O LORD, hast not forsaken those that seek thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the LORD, he who dwells in Zion; declare among the people his doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he makes requirement for blood, he remembers them; he does not forget the cry of the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer from those that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may show forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Gentiles are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid their own foot is taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is known by the judgment which he has executed; the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion (meditate on this for ever). Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked shall be put into Sheol, all the Gentiles that forget God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the humble shall not always be forgotten: the hope of the poor shall not perish for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the Gentiles be judged in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put fear into them, O LORD: that the Gentiles may know themselves to be but men. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost thou stand afar off, O LORD? Why dost thou hide thyself in times of trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked in his pride persecutes the poor; let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wicked boasts of his heart’s desire and blesses the covetous, whom the LORD abhors.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, does not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight; as for all his enemies, he puffs at them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has said in his heart, I shall not be moved, for I shall never be in adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sits in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places he murders the innocent: his eyes are secretly set against the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lies in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lies in wait to catch the poor: he catches the poor when he draws him into his net.
speaker: Narrator

text: He crouches and hides himself, and many are those who fall under his power.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has said in his heart, God has forgotten; he hides his face; he will never see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand; forget not the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: In what does the wicked irritate God? He has said in his heart, Thou wilt not require accountability.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast seen it, for thou dost behold mischief and spite to requite it with thy hand: the poor commits himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man; seek out his wickedness until thou find none.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is King for ever and ever; the Gentiles are perished out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart; thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
speaker: Narrator

text: to judge the fatherless and the oppressed that the man of the earth may no longer oppress.
speaker: Narrator

text: I put my trust in the LORD: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, the wicked bend their bow; they make ready their arrow upon the string that they may secretly shoot at the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foundations shall be destroyed. What has the righteous done?
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is in the temple of his holiness, the LORD’s throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD tries the righteous, but the wicked and he that loves violence his soul hates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, with winds of whirlwinds: this shall be the portion of their cup.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the righteous LORD loves righteousness; his countenance beholds the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help, LORD; for the merciful man ceases, for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each one speaks vanity with his neighbour: they speak with flattering lips and with a double heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips and the tongue that speaks proud things:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who have said, With our tongue we will prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now I will arise, saith the LORD; I will set in safety the one whom the wicked one has ensnared.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked press in on every side when the vilest men are exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God: lighten mine eyes lest I sleep the sleep of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing unto the LORD because he has dealt bountifully with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool has said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is no one that does good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men to see if there were any that did understand and seek God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is no one that does good, no, not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The workers of iniquity certainly know this; those who eat up my people as they eat bread and do not call upon the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they were in great fear: for God is with the nation of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor because the LORD is his hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that the saving health of Israel were come out of Zion! When the LORD turns back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in the mountain of thy holiness?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walks in integrity and works righteousness, and speaks the truth in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that does not backbite with his tongue nor does evil to his neighbour nor takes up a reproach against his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: In whose eyes the vile person is not esteemed; but he honours those that fear the LORD. He that swears to his own hurt and does not change.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that does not put out his money to usury nor takes a bribe against the innocent. He that does these things shall never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve me, O God: for in thee I have put my trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said unto the LORD, Thou art my goodness: I have no goodness apart from thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the saints that are in the earth and to the excellent: all my delight is towards them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of those that hasten after another god shall be multiplied; their drink offerings of blood I will not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup; thou dost maintain my lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a beautiful inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bless the LORD, who gives me counsel: my kidneys also instruct me in the night seasons.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set the LORD always before me: because when he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoices: my flesh also shall rest secure.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou wilt not leave my soul in Sheol; neither wilt thou suffer thy Merciful One to see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt show me the path of life: in thy presence is fullness of joy; in thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear righteousness, O LORD, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that does not go out of feigned lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast proved my heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast refined me and hast found no iniquity; that which I thought did not pass through my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have observed the ways of the violent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sustain my steps in thy ways that my footsteps not slip.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have called upon thee, because thou dost hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me and hear my speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show thy mercy to be marvellous, O Saviour of those who put their trust in thee, from those that rise up against thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me as the apple of the eye; hide me with the shadow of thy wings,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are closed in with their own fat; with their mouth they speak proudly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes upon throwing us down to the earth
speaker: Narrator

text: like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O LORD, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, with thy sword;
speaker: Narrator

text: from men, with thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, who have their portion in this life and whose belly thou dost fill with thy provision: they satisfy their sons and leave the rest to their family.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness; I shall be satisfied when I awake with thy likeness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will love thee, O LORD, my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is my rock and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised, so shall I be saved from my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pain of death compassed me, and the rivers of Belial made me afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pain of Sheol compassed me about: the snares of death came before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my distress I called upon the LORD and cried unto my God; he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations of the mountains collapsed and were removed because he was wroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Smoke went up out of his nostrils, and fire devoured out of his mouth; coals were kindled by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lowered the heavens and came down; and darkness was under his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he rode upon a cherub and flew: yea, he flew upon the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made darkness his hiding place; in his tabernacle round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent out his arrows and scattered them; he shot out lightnings and destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the depths of the waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from those who hated me, even though they were too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were ready for me in the day of my calamity, but the LORD was my staff.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me forth also into a wide place; he delivered me because he delighted in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will reward me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands he shall recompense me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I have kept the ways of the LORD and did not become wicked departing in apostasy from my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was perfect before him, and I kept myself from my iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the LORD has recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands before his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the merciful thou wilt show thyself merciful; with a perfect man thou wilt show thyself perfect;
speaker: Narrator

text: with the pure thou wilt show thyself pure; and with the perverse thou wilt show thyself adversary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou wilt save the humble people; but wilt bring down high looks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou wilt light my fire: the LORD my God will enlighten my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with thee I have scattered armies; and in my God I have overcome walled defenses.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the LORD is precise: a shield to all those that wait in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is God except the LORD? or who is a refuge except our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is God that girds me with strength and makes my way perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes my feet like hinds’ feet and sets me upon my high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: He trains my hands for the battle, so that a bow of bronze shall be broken by my arms.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand will hold me up, and thy meekness shall multiply me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shall enlarge my steps under me, and my knees shall not tremble.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall pursue my enemies and overtake them: neither shall I turn again until they are consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall smite them, and they will not be able to rise: they shall fall under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued my enemies under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast also given me the necks of my enemies that I might destroy those that hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried out, but there was no one to save them: even unto the LORD, but he did not answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I beat them as small as the dust before the wind: I scattered them as the dirt in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and thou hast made me the head of the Gentiles: a people whom I did not know served me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as they heard of me, they obeyed me: the sons of strangers submitted themselves unto me even against their will.
speaker: Narrator

text: The strangers fell away and were afraid in their close places.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD lives; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is God that avenges me and subdues the peoples under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He delivers me from my enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the one who would betray me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the Gentiles and sing praises unto thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives great deliverance to his king and shows mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament shows the work of his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: One day provides a word for the next day, and one night declares wisdom unto the next night.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them he has set a tabernacle for the sun,
speaker: Narrator

text: which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber and rejoices as a strong man to run a race.
speaker: Narrator

text: His going forth is from the end of the heavens, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul; the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever; the rights of the LORD are true, they are all just.
speaker: Narrator

text: More to be desired are they than gold, than much fine gold; sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover by them is thy slave warned, and in keeping them there is great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep back thy slave also from pride and arrogance; let them not have dominion over me; then I shall be perfect, and I shall be innocent of the great rebellion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the LORD hear thee in the day of trouble; let the name of the God of Jacob lift thee up
speaker: Narrator

text: and send thee help from the sanctuary and strengthen thee out of Zion
speaker: Narrator

text: and remember all thy offerings and reduce thy burnt sacrifice to the ashes of burnt fat, Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grant thee according to thine heart and fulfil all thy counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will rejoice in thy saving health, and in the name of our God we will be standard-bearers: let the LORD fulfil all thy petitions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now know I that the LORD has kept his anointed; he will hear him from the heavens of his holiness with the saving valour of his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we will remember the name of the LORD our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are brought down and fallen, but we are risen and stand upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD saves the king; let him hear us on the day when we call.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king shall joy in thy strength, O LORD; and in thy saving health how greatly shall he rejoice!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire and hast not withheld the request of his lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou givest him beforehand the blessings of goodness; thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked life of thee, and thou didst give him length of days for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: His glory is great in thy saving health; honour and beauty hast thou laid upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever; thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the king trusts in the LORD, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies; thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger; the LORD shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth and their seed from among the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they intended evil against thee; they imagined a wicked device, but they did not prevail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shalt thou separate them; thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou exalted, LORD, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy valour.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me and from the words of my cry?
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest in the midst of the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried unto thee and were delivered: they trusted in thee and were not confounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men and despised of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn him over to the LORD, let him deliver him, let him save him, seeing he delighted in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou art he that took me out of the womb; thou hast made me wait upon thee since I was upon my mother’s breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was cast upon thee from the womb; thou art my God from my mother’s belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: They opened their mouth upon me as a ravening and a roaring lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.
speaker: Narrator

text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaves to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: I may count all my bones: they look and stare upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They part my garments among them and cast lots upon my vesture.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver my soul from the sword; my life from the power of the dog.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me from the lion’s mouth and from the horns of the unicorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will declare thy name unto my brethren; in the midst of the congregation I will praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the poor in spirit; neither has he hid his face from him, but when he cried unto him, he heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation; I will pay my vows before those that fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The poor shall eat and be satisfied: those that seek him shall praise the LORD; your heart shall live for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn unto the LORD; and all the families of the Gentiles shall worship before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the kingdom is the LORD’s, and he shall have dominion over the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those that are fat upon earth shall eat and worship; all those that go down to the dust shall bow before him; and no one can keep his own soul alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall come and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he has done this.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes me to lie down in green pastures; he leads me beside the still waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He restores my soul: he leads me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff shall comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies; thou hast anointed my head with oil; my cup is running over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will rest in the house of the LORD for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is the LORD’s, and the fullness thereof; the world and they that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has founded it upon the seas and established it upon the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall ascend into the hill of the LORD? or who shall stand in the place of his holiness?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that has clean hands and a pure heart, who has not taken my name in vain, nor sworn deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from the God of his saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the generation of those that seek him, that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and lift yourselves up, ye everlasting doors, and the King of glory shall come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, the LORD mighty in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; lift yourselves up, ye everlasting doors, and the King of glory shall come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of the hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee, O LORD, do I lift up my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not my enemies triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, none that wait on thee shall be ashamed; those which rebel without cause shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me thy ways, O LORD; teach me thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to walk in thy truth and teach me: for thou art the God of my saving health; I have waited for thee all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, O LORD, thy compassion and thy mercies, for they have been ever of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my rebellions; according to thy mercy remember me for thy goodness’ sake, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good and upright is the LORD: therefore he will teach sinners in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will cause the humble to pass through the judgment, and the meek he will teach his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy name’s sake, O LORD, pardon my iniquity; for it is great.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the man that fears the LORD? Him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: His soul shall rest in that which is good; and his seed shall inherit the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The secret of the LORD is for those that fear him, and he will show them his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes are ever toward the LORD, for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn thee unto me and have mercy upon me, for I am desolate and afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The troubles of my heart are enlarged; O bring thou me out of my distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon my affliction and my pain and forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider my enemies, for they are multiplied; and they hate me with cruel hatred.
speaker: Narrator

text: O keep my soul and deliver me; let me not be ashamed, for I put my trust in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Integrity and uprightness shall preserve me, for I have waited for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ransom Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O LORD, for I have walked in my integrity; I have trusted also in the LORD; therefore I shall not slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Examine me, O LORD and prove me; melt my kidneys and my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy mercy is before my eyes, and I walk in thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not sat with vain persons, neither will I go in with hypocrites.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated the congregation of evil doers and will not sit with the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will wash my hands in innocency, so I will walk near unto thine altar, O LORD:
speaker: Narrator

text: That I may publish with the voice of thanksgiving and tell of all thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, I have loved the habitation of thy house and the place of the tabernacle of thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather not my soul with the sinners, nor my life with those who have blood on their hands:
speaker: Narrator

text: In whose hands are wicked devices, and their right hand is full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will walk in my integrity; ransom me and be merciful unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have walked uprightly; in the congregations I will bless the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wicked, even my enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though a host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life to behold the beauty of the LORD and to enquire in his temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his tabernacle; in the secret of his tent shall he hide me; he shall set me high upon a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now shall my head be lifted up above my enemies round about me; therefore I will offer sacrifices of joy in his tabernacle; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart has spoken unto me from thee, Seek my face. Thy face, O LORD, will I seek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy slave away in anger: thou hast been my help; do not leave me or forsake me, O God of my saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my father and my mother have left me, and the LORD has taken me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a right path because of my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me not over unto the will of my enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me and such as breathe out cruelty.
speaker: Narrator

text: I had fainted unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait for the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart; wait, I say, for the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee will I cry, O LORD my rock; be not silent unto me lest, if thou be silent unto me, I become like those that go down into the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward the oracle of thy holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not catch me away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace to their neighbours, but evil is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give them according to their deeds and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render unto them their desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they do not regard the works of the LORD nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them and not build them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD because he has heard the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped; therefore my heart greatly rejoices; and with my song I will praise him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is the strength of his people, and he is the saving strength of his anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save thy people and bless thine inheritance; feed them also and lift them up for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the LORD, O ye mighty, give unto the LORD glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name; worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the LORD is upon the waters: the God of glory thunders: the LORD is upon many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is full of majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars; yea, the LORD broke the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He made them skip like calves; Lebanon and Sirion like the sons of the unicorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the LORD divides the flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the LORD that shall shake the wilderness; the LORD shall shake the wilderness of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the LORD shall make the hinds to calve and shall uncover the forests: and in his temple every one speaks to his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD sits upon the flood; yea, the LORD sat down as King for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will give strength unto his people; the LORD will bless his people in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol; thou gavest me life from my descent into the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his merciful ones sing unto the LORD, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his anger endures but a moment; in his will is life; weeping may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong; thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will cry unto thee, O GOD; and unto the Lord will I make supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text: What profit is there in my blood when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? Shall it declare thy truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O LORD and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast turned my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the end that I may sing glory unto thee and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: In thee, O LORD, have I waited; let me never be ashamed; deliver me in thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline thine ear unto me; deliver me speedily; be thou my strong rock, for a house of defence to save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake thou shalt lead me and guide me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt pull me out of the net that they have laid in secret for me; for thou art my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into thy hand shall I commit my spirit; thou shalt ransom me, O LORD God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have hated those that regard lying vanities; but I wait in the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy, for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities
speaker: Narrator

text: and hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy; thou hast set my feet in a wide place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble: my eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my life is spent with grief and my years with sighing: my strength fails because of my iniquity, and my bones are consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was a reproach among all my enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to my acquaintances: those that see me without flee from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I have become like a lost vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have heard the slander of many; fear was on every side; while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I trusted in thee, O LORD; I said, Thou art my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of my enemies and from those that persecute me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make thy face to shine upon thy slave; save me for thy mercies’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD, for I have called upon thee; let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be cut off for Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for those that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for those that wait in thee before the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep them in the secret place of thy face from the pride of man; thou shalt keep them in the tabernacle protected from the strife of tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD, for he has shown me his marvellous mercy in a strong city.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes; nevertheless thou hast heard the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O love the LORD, all ye his merciful ones, for the LORD preserves the faithful and plentifully rewards the proud doer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be of good courage and strengthen your hearts, all ye that wait in the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man unto whom the LORD does not impute iniquity and in whose spirit there is no guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my green growth is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and I have not hid my iniquity. I said, I will confess (against myself) my rebellions unto the LORD, and thou shalt forgive the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this shall every one that is merciful pray unto thee in the time when thou may be found; surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come near unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go; I will fix mine eyes upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye not as the horse or as the mule, which have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in subjection with bit and bridle, or they will not come near unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many sorrows for the wicked; but he that waits in the LORD, mercy shall compass him round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, ye righteous, and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous, for to the upright praise is beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Celebrate unto the LORD with harp; sing unto him with the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto him a new song; play unto excellence with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the word of the LORD is right, and all his works are done in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He loves righteousness and judgment; the earth is full of the mercy of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap; he lays up the deeps for treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he spoke, and it was done; he commanded, and it came into being.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD brings the counsel of the Gentiles to nought; he makes the devices of the peoples of no effect.
speaker: Narrator

text: The counsel of the LORD stands for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the people whose God is the LORD; the people whom he has chosen for his own inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD looked from heaven; he saw all the sons of Adam.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the place of his habitation he looked upon all the inhabitants of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He fashioned all of their hearts; he considers all their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king is not saved by the multitude of the army; the mighty man does not escape by much strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: A horse is a vain thing for salvation; neither shall he deliver any by his great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon those that fear him, upon those that wait for his mercy
speaker: Narrator

text: to deliver their souls from death and to keep them alive in the famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul waited for the LORD; he is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore our heart shall rejoice in him because we have trusted in the name of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy mercy, O LORD, be upon us, according as we have waited upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bless the LORD at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul shall glory in the LORD; the meek shall hear of this, and be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: O magnify the LORD with me, and let us exalt his name together.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sought the LORD, and he heard me and delivered me from all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text: They looked unto him and were lightened, and their faces were not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This poor man cried out, and the LORD heard him and saved him out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the LORD encamps round about those that fear him and delivers them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O taste and see that the LORD is good; blessed is the man that shall trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O fear the LORD, ye his saints; for those that fear him lack nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions do lack and suffer hunger, but those that seek the LORD shall not lack any good thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, ye children, hearken unto me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the man that desires life and loves many days that he may see good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: The anger of the LORD is against those that do evil to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous cried out, and the LORD heard and delivered them out of all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is near unto those that are of a broken heart and saves such as are of a contrite spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the LORD shall deliver him out of them all,
speaker: Narrator

text: keeping all his bones; not one of them shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evil shall slay the wicked; and those that hate the righteous shall be declared guilty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD ransoms the soul of his slaves, and none of those that trust in him shall be declared guilty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Plead my cause, O LORD, with those that strive with me; fight against those that fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up in my help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against those that persecute me; say unto my soul; I am thy saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul; let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the angel of the LORD chase them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their way be dark and slippery, and let the angel of the LORD persecute them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For without cause they have hid their net for me in a pit, which without cause they have dug for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let destruction come upon him at unawares, and let his net that he has hid catch himself; into that very destruction let him fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD; it shall rejoice in his saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: All my bones shall say, LORD, who is like unto thee, who delivers the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoils him?
speaker: Narrator

text: False witnesses rose up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They rewarded me evil for good until my soul was alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth; I humbled my soul with fasting, and my prayer rose up in my bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother; I bowed down heavily, as one that mourns for his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in my adversity they rejoiced and gathered themselves together; yea, the smiters gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they tore me apart and did not cease:
speaker: Narrator

text: With immature hypocritical mockers, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long wilt thou look on? Restore my soul from their destructions, my life from the lions.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation; I will praise thee among many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not those that are my enemies wrongfully rejoice over me; neither let those that hate me wink with the eye without a cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they do not speak peace, but they devise deceitful matters against those that are meek in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me and said, Aha, aha, our eye has seen it.
speaker: Narrator

text: This thou hast seen, O LORD; do not keep silence; O Lord, do not be far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stir up thyself and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it; let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at my hurt; let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them shout for joy and be glad that favour my righteous cause; let them say continually, Let the LORD be magnified, who has pleasure in the peace of his slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rebellion of the wicked saith to my heart that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he flatters himself in his own eyes until his iniquity is found to be hateful.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit; he has left off to be wise and to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text: He devises iniquity upon his bed; he sets himself in a way that is not good; he does not abhor evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy mercy, O LORD, reaches unto the heavens, and thy truth reaches unto the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness is like the mountains of God; thy judgments are a great deep; O LORD, thou dost preserve man and beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: How excellent is thy mercy, O God! therefore the sons of Adam cover themselves in the shadow of thy wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house, and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with thee is the fountain of life; in thy light shall we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Extend thy mercy unto those that know thee and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are the workers of iniquity fallen; they are cast down and shall not be able to rise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be angry with the evildoers, neither be thou envious of the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass and wither as the green herb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait in the LORD and do good; live in the land and uphold the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner delight thyself in the LORD, and he shall give thee the desires of thy heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn thy way unto the LORD and wait in him, and he shall bring it to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light and thy uprightness as the noonday.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be silent before the LORD and wait patiently for him; do not be angry with him who prospers in his way, with the man who brings wicked devices to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cease from anger and forsake wrath: let not thy wrath in any wise cause you to become evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For evildoers shall be cut off; but those that wait for the LORD, they shall inherit the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be; thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the meek shall inherit the earth and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked plots against the just and gnashes upon him with his teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall laugh at him, for he sees that his day is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow to cast down the poor and needy and to slay such as are of upright conversation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bow shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: A little that a righteous man has is better than the many riches of the sinners.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but the LORD upholds the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD knows the days of the perfect, and their inheritance shall be for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time, and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD as the fattest of rams shall be consumed; as smoke they shall fade away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked borrows and does not repay: but the righteous shows mercy and gives.
speaker: Narrator

text: For such as are blessed of him shall inherit the earth, and those that are cursed of him shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD, and he delights in his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though he falls, he shall not be utterly cast down, for the LORD upholds him with his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been young and now am old; yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is ever merciful and lends, and his seed is a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart from evil, and do good, and thou shalt live for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD loves uprightness and does not forsake his merciful ones; they are preserved for ever, but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall inherit the earth and live upon it for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom, and his tongue brings forth judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of his God is in his heart; therefore none of his steps shall slide.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked watches the righteous and seeks to slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait on the LORD and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the earth; when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen the wicked in great power and spreading himself like a green bay tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he passed away, and, behold, he was not: I sought him, but he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mark the perfect, and behold the upright, for the end of each one of them is peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the rebels were destroyed all together; the wicked were cut off in the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the salvation of the righteous is the LORD; he is their strength in the time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD helped them and delivers them; he shall deliver them from the wicked and save them because they wait in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presses me sore.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my iniquities are gone over my head; as a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease, and there is no soundness in my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am feeble and sore broken; I roar by reason of the disquietness of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, all my desire is before thee, and my groaning is not hid from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart pants, my strength fails me; as for the light of my eyes, it also is gone from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My friends and my companions stand aloof from my sore, and my kinsmen stand afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that seek after my life lay snares for me, and those that seek my hurt speak calamities and imagine deceits all the day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I, as a deaf man heard not, and was as a dumb man that did not open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I was as a man that does not hear, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thee, O LORD, do I wait; thou wilt respond, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said, Let them not rejoice over me; let them not magnify themselves against me when my foot slips.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will declare my iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my enemies are alive, and they are strong, and those that hate me wrongfully are multiplied;
speaker: Narrator

text: rendering evil for good they are against me because I follow that which is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forsake me not, O LORD; O my God, be not far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, I will take heed to my ways that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bit while the wicked is against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was dumb with silence; I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned; then I spoke with my tongue,
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, make me to know my end and the measure of my days, what it is that I may know how long I am to be of this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou hast made my days as a handbreadth, and my age is as nothing before thee; verily every man that lives is altogether vanity. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely man walks in darkness; surely they are disquieted in vain; they heap up riches not knowing who shall gather them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Lord, what shall I wait for? My hope is in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from all my rebellions; do not make me the reproach of the foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth because thou didst it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou with chastening dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his greatness to consume away like a moth; surely every man is vanity. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
speaker: Narrator

text: O spare me, that I may recover strength before I go from here and be no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: I waited patiently for the LORD, and he inclined unto me and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me up also out of the pit of hopelessness, out of the miry clay and set my feet upon a rock and straightened my steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God; many shall see it and fear and shall wait on the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that man that makes the LORD his trust and does not respect the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast increased, O LORD my God, thy wonderful works which thou hast done and thy thoughts regarding us; they are beyond our ability to express, declare, or speak; they cannot be told.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened; burnt offering and sin offering thou hast not required.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said I, Behold, I come; in the volume of the book it is written of me,
speaker: Narrator

text: I delight to do thy will, O my God; thy law is within my bowels.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation; behold, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy truth and thy salvation; I have not concealed thy mercy and thy truth from the great congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not withhold thy tender mercies from me, O LORD; let thy mercy and thy truth continually preserve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For innumerable evils have compassed me about; my iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to see; they are more than the hairs of my head; therefore my heart fails me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me; O LORD, make haste to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my life to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee; let such as love thy salvation say continually, The LORD be magnified.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I am poor and needy; the Lord will remember me; thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he that understands regarding the poor; the LORD will deliver him in the day of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will preserve him and keep him alive, and he shall be blessed upon the earth, and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing; thou wilt soften all his bed in his sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me; heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: My enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die and his name perish?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he came to see me, he spoke lies: his heart gathered iniquity to itself, and when he goes out, he tells it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that hate me congregate together and murmur against me; against me do they devise my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: A disease of Belial, they say, cleaves fast unto him, and now that he lies he shall rise up no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the man of my peace, in whom I trusted, who ate of my bread, has lifted up his heel against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me and raise me up that I may requite them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this I shall know that I have pleased thee, that my enemy does not triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for me, thou sustained me in my integrity and hast seated me before thy face for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the hart pants after the water brooks, so does my soul pant after thee, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God; when shall I come and appear before God?
speaker: Narrator

text: My tears have been my food day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will remember these things; I will pour out my soul in me. When I shall be included in the number; I will go with them to the house of God with voice of joy and praise, dancing in the multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted against me? Wait thou for God, for I shall yet praise him for the wellbeing of his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, my soul is cast down within me; therefore I will remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the mountain of Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deep calls unto deep at the voice of thy waterspouts; all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the LORD will command his mercy in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say unto God, My rock, why hast thou forgotten me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is as death in my bones when my enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? Wait thou for God, for I shall yet praise him, who is the saving health of my countenance and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against those who are not merciful; O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art the God of my strength; why dost thou cast me off? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
speaker: Narrator

text: O send out thy light and thy truth; let them lead me; let them bring me unto the mountain of thy holiness and to thy tabernacles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will enter in to the altar of God, unto the God of my exceeding joy; yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? Wait for God, for I shall yet praise him, who is the saving health of my countenance and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days in the times of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: How thou didst drive out the Gentiles with thy hand and plant them in their place; how thou didst afflict the peoples and cast them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they did not get the land in inheritance by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them, but thy right hand and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance because thy delight was in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my King, O God; command saving health unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through thee will we push down our enemies; through thy name will we tread under those that rise up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast saved us from our enemies and hast put to shame those that hated us.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God we boast all the day long and praise thy name for ever. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast cast us off and put us to shame and doth not go forth with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy, and we are spoiled by those who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given us over like sheep appointed for food and hast scattered us among the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast sold thy people for nothing and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to those that are round about us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest us a byword among the Gentiles, a shaking of the head among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face has covered me,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the voice of him that reproaches and blasphemes by reason of the enemy and of the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this is come upon us; yet we have not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way
speaker: Narrator

text: though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons and covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have forgotten the name of our God or stretched out our hands to a strange god,
speaker: Narrator
