text: shall not God search this out? For he knows the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? Arise, do not cast us off for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost thou hide thy face and forget our affliction and our oppression?
speaker: Narrator

text: For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our belly cleaves unto the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise for our help and ransom us for thy mercies’ sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is overflowing with a good word; I speak of the things which I have done concerning the king; my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art fairer than the sons of men, grace is poured into thy lips; therefore God has blessed thee for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most valiant, with thy glory and thy majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in thy majesty be prospered; ride upon the word of truth and of humility and of righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine arrows, by which the peoples fall under thee, penetrate the heart of the enemies of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy throne, O God, is eternal and for ever, the rod of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness; therefore God, thy God, has anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy garments smell of myrrh and aloes and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, by which they have made thee glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings’ daughters were among thy honourable women; the queen stands at thy right hand with a crown of gold from Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken, O daughter, and consider and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house;
speaker: Narrator

text: so shall the king greatly desire thy beauty; and bow before him, for he is thy Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall intreat thy favour.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king’s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework; the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought; they shall enter into the king’s palace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy sons, whom thou shalt make princes in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations; therefore shall the people praise thee eternally and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be removed and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the violence thereof. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a river, the streams of which shall make glad the city of God, the sanctuary of the tents of the most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved; God shall help her, as the morning dawns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Gentiles raged, the kingdoms were moved; he uttered his voice, the earth melted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD of the hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, behold the works of the LORD, what desolations he has made in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaks the bow and cuts the spear in sunder; he burns the chariot in the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted in the Gentiles, I will be exalted in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD of the hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: O clap your hands, all ye people; shout unto God with the voice of triumph.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD most high is terrible; he is a great King over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall guide the peoples under us, and the Gentiles under our feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall choose our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is gone up with a shout of joy, the LORD with the sound of the shofar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises unto our King, sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is the King of all the earth; sing ye praises with understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: God reigns over the Gentiles; God sits upon the throne of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The princes of the peoples have joined the people of the God of Abraham; for the shields of the earth belong unto God; he is greatly exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the mountain of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is Mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is known in her palaces for a refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.
speaker: Narrator

text: They saw it, and so they marvelled; they were troubled and hasted away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear took hold upon them there and pain as of a woman in travail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the LORD of the hosts, in the city of our God; God will establish it for ever. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have conceived according to thy mercy, O God, in the midst of thy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth; thy right hand is full of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad because of thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Walk about Zion and go round about her; tell the towers thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces that ye may tell it to the generation following.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this God is our God eternally and for ever; he will be our guide even unto death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:
speaker: Narrator

text: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall speak wisdom; and the meditation of my heart intelligence.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will incline mine ear to a parable; I will declare my enigma upon the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should I fear in the days of adversity when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that trust in their wealth and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
speaker: Narrator

text: none of them can by any means ransom his brother, nor give God an atonement for him;
speaker: Narrator

text: (for the redemption of their soul is of great price, and they shall never pay it)
speaker: Narrator

text: that he should still live for ever and not see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he sees that all the wise men die, likewise the fool and the ignorant perish and leave their wealth to others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their inward thought is that their houses are eternal and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless man will not abide forever in honour; he is like the beasts that are cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: This their way is their folly; yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like sheep they are laid in Sheol; death shall feed on them, and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning, and their beauty shall be consumed in the grave from their dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely God will ransom my soul from the hand of Sheol when he shall take me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;
speaker: Narrator

text: for in his death he shall carry nothing away; nor shall his glory descend after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though while he lives, his life shall be blessed: and men will praise thee when thou art prosperous.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall enter into the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man that is in honour that does not understand is like the beasts that are cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of gods, even the LORD, has spoken and convocated the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our God shall come and shall not keep silence; a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall convocate the heavens of above, and the earth, that he may judge his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather my merciful ones together unto me, those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness, for God himself is the judge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee; I am God, even thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not reprove thee regarding thy sacrifices; thy burnt offerings are continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every beast of the forest is mine and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know all the fowls of the mountains; and the wild beasts of the field are with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee; for the world is mine and the fullness thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Must I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?
speaker: Narrator

text: Sacrifice praise unto God and pay thy vows unto the most High
speaker: Narrator

text: and call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto the wicked God saith, What part hast thou to declare my statutes or that thou should take my covenant in thy mouth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing thou dost hate chastening and dost cast my words behind thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou didst see a thief, then thou didst consent with him and hast been partaker with adulterers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst give thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frames deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst sit and speak against thy brother; thou didst slander thine own mother’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou didst think that I was altogether such a one as thyself, but I will reprove thee and set them in order before thine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I take you away, and there be none to deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever sacrifices praise glorifies me; and to him that orders his ways aright I will show the salvation of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy mercy; according unto the multitude of thy compassion eradicate my rebellion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I acknowledge my rebellion; and my sin is ever before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against thee, against thee only, have I sinned and done this evil in thy sight that thou be declared just in thy word and pure in thy judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the pain of my iniquity has caused me to writhe; my mother conceived me so that sin might be removed from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou dost desire truth in the inward parts, and in the secret things thou hast made me to know wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove the sin in me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me to hear joy and gladness that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide thy face from my sins and eradicate all my iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast me not away from thy presence and take not thy Holy Spirit from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Restore unto me the joy of thy saving health, and thy spirit of liberty shall uphold me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will teach transgressors thy ways, and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation, and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, open my lips; and my mouth shall show forth thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou dost not desire sacrifice or else would I give it; thou dost not delight in burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion; build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, the burnt offering, the offering that has been totally consumed by the fire; then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost thou boast of evil, O strong man? The mercy of God is day by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy tongue devises wickedness like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost love evil more than good; and lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost love all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shall likewise cast thee down for ever; he shall cut thee off and pluck thee out of thy dwelling place and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous also shall see and fear and shall laugh at him, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, this is the man that did not make God his strength, but trusted in the abundance of his riches and strengthened himself in his wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I trust in the eternal mercy of God for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee for ever because thou hast done it, and I will wait on thy name, for it is good before thy merciful ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool has said in his heart, There is no God. They have corrupted themselves and have done abominable iniquity; there is no one that does good.
speaker: Narrator

text: God looked down from heaven upon the sons of Adam to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every one of them is gone back; they are altogether become filthy; there is no one that does good, no, not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread; they have not called upon God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were there in great fear where no fear was; for God has scattered the bones of him that encamps against thee: thou hast put them to shame because God has despised them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that the saving health of Israel were come out of Zion! When God brings back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me, O God, in thy name and defend me by thy valour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul; they have not set God before them. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, God is my helper; the Lord is with those that uphold my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall reward evil unto my enemies; cut them off in thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will freely sacrifice unto thee; I will praise thy name, O LORD; for it is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has delivered me out of all trouble, and my eye has seen his desire upon my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ear to my prayer, O God, and do not hide thyself from my supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attend unto me and hear me: I mourn in my complaint and make a noise
speaker: Narrator

text: because of the voice of the enemy because of the oppression of the wicked; for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is sore pained within me, and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror has overwhelmed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then I would fly away and be at rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, then I would flee far away and dwell in the wilderness. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues, for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof; iniquity also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wickedness is in the midst thereof; deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it, neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
speaker: Narrator

text: But it was thou, who in my estimation was, my lord, and of my own family.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took sweet counsel together and walked unto the house of God in company.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be condemned unto death, and let them go down alive into Sheol for wickedness is in their dwellings and among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, I will call upon God, and the LORD shall save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evening and morning and at noon I will pray and cry aloud, and he shall hear my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has ransomed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me, for there were many against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shall hear and bring them down, even he that abides from of old. Selah. Because they do not change, nor do they fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him; he has defiled his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart; his words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee; he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of the grave; bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days, but I will trust in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be merciful unto me, O God, for man would swallow me up; he oppresses me fighting me daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: My enemies would daily swallow me up, for they are many that fight against me, O thou most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every day my life is filled with sorrow; all their thoughts are against me for evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps when they wait for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall they escape by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the peoples, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou tellest my wanderings; put my tears into thy bottle; are they not in thy book?
speaker: Narrator

text: When I cry unto thee, then shall my enemies be turned back; in this I know that God is for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God I will praise his word; in the LORD I will praise his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God I have put my trust; I will not be afraid of what man can do unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy promises are upon me, O God; I will render praises unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast delivered my life from death; thou hast kept my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me: for my soul trusts in thee; and in the shadow of thy wings I will make my refuge until these calamities are overpast.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will cry unto God most high, unto God that performs all things for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall send from the heavens and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is among lions, and I lie even among those that are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows and their tongue a sharp sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down; they have dug a pit before me, into the midst of which they are fallen themselves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is willing; I will sing and give praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp; I myself will arise early.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing unto thee among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy mercy is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of Adam?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, in heart ye work iniquity; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked are estranged from the womb; they go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent; they are like the deaf adder that stops her ear,
speaker: Narrator

text: which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth; break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them melt away as waters which run continually; when he bends his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a snail which melts, let them pass away, like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before your pots can feel the fire of the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous; verily there is a God that judges in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; defend me from those that rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity and save me from bloodthirsty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul; the strong are gathered against me; I am not in rebellion, nor in sin, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: They run and prepare themselves when I have committed no iniquity; awake to help me and behold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, therefore, O LORD God of the hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the Gentiles; be not merciful to any rebellious workers of iniquity. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will return at evening; they will bark like dogs and go round about outside the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they belch out with their mouth; swords are in their lips; for who, say they, doth hear?
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the Gentiles in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will reserve his strength unto thee, for God is my defence.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of my mercy shall meet me on the way; God shall let me see my desire upon my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slay them not lest my people forget; scatter them by thy power and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips, let them even be taken in their pride; they shall be subject to weakness and to a curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consume them in wrath, consume them that they may not be and let them know that God rules in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at evening let them return and let them bark like dogs and go round about outside the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them wander up and down for food and murmur if they are not satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will sing of thy power; I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning, for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing, for God is my defence and the God of my mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us; thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it; heal its breaches, for it shakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast showed thy people hard things; thou hast made us to drink the wine of shaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast given a banner to those that fear thee that they raise up for the truth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thy beloved may be delivered, save with thy right hand and hear me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem and mete out the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my lawgiver;
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab is my washpot; over Edom I will cast out my shoe; Philistia, triumph thou because of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thou, O God, who had cast us off; and thou, O God, who did not go out with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give us help from trouble, for vain is the salvation of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through God we shall do valiantly, for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the end of the earth I will cry unto thee when my heart is overwhelmed; lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast been a shelter for me and a strong tower from the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever; I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows; thou hast given an inheritance to those that fear thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt add days upon days unto the king’s life; his years shall be from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall abide before God for ever; He is aware of mercy and truth which preserve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will sing thy name for ever, performing my vows each day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only in God does my soul rest; from him comes my saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: He only is my rock and my saving health; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? Shall ye murder each other until ye are as a bowing wall and as a tottering fence?
speaker: Narrator

text: They only consult to cast him down from his greatness; they delight in lies; they bless with their mouth, but they curse in their inward parts. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul, rest thou only in God, for my hope is from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He only is my rock and my saving health; he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God is my saving health and my glory; the rock of my strength and my refuge is in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait in him at all times; ye peoples, pour out your heart before him; God is our refuge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the sons of Adam are vanity, and the sons of nobles are a lie; to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust not in violence and become not vain in the taking of spoil; if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has spoken once; twice have I heard this that power belongs unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongs mercy, for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee; my soul thirsts for thee; my flesh longs for thee in a dry and thirsty land where there is no water;
speaker: Narrator

text: in this manner I beheld thee in holiness when I beheld thy power and thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thy mercy is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus will I bless thee in my life; in thy name shall I lift up my hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips
speaker: Narrator

text: When I remember thee upon my bed and meditate on thee in the night watches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul has followed hard after thee; thy right hand has upheld me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those that sought my soul, to destroy it, descended into the lower parts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be slain by the sword; they shall be a portion for foxes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that swears by him shall be praised; for the mouth of those that speak lies shall be stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer; preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked, from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who whet their tongue like a sword and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect; suddenly do they shoot at him and fear not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They encourage themselves in an evil matter; they attempt to hide the snares; they say, Who shall see them?
speaker: Narrator

text: They search out iniquities; they perfect and put into effect that which they have invented in the inward thought of each one of them and that which they have devised in their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall make their own council and agreements to fall upon themselves; all that see them shall flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all men shall fear and shall declare the work of God, for they shall understand his doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD and shall become secure in him, and all the upright in heart shall glory in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise doth rest in thee, O God, in Sion and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Words of iniquity overwhelmed me, but thou shalt purge away our rebellion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man whom thou dost choose and cause to approach unto thee that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house even of thy holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: With tremendous things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our saving health, who art the hope of all the ends of the earth and of those that are afar off upon the sea:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art he who doth establish the mountains by thy strength, being girded with valour:
speaker: Narrator

text: He who stills the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves and the tumult of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy wonders; thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost visit the earth, and when thou hast caused it to want, thou dost greatly enrich it with the river of God, which is full of water; thou dost prepare their grain, according to thy will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost water its rows abundantly; thou dost settle its furrows; thou dost make it soft with showers of rain; thou dost bless its sprouting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost crown the year with thy goodness, and thy clouds distill fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They fall upon the habitations of the wilderness; and the hills gird themselves with happiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plains clothe themselves with sheep, and the valleys cover themselves with grain; they give shouts of triumph, they even sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make a joyful noise unto God, all the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: sing forth the glory of his name; put glory into thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! Through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the earth shall worship thee and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and see the works of God; he is terrible in his doing toward the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned the sea into dry land; they went through the river on foot; there did we rejoice in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He rules by his power for ever; his eyes watch the Gentiles; the rebellious shall not exalt themselves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: O bless our God, ye peoples, and make the voice of his praise to be heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is he who placed our soul into life and did not suffer our feet to slip.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, O God, hast proved us; thou hast refined us as silver is refined.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst bring us into the net; thou didst lay affliction upon our loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast placed a man over our head; we went through fire and through water, but thou didst bring us out into abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings; I will pay thee my vows,
speaker: Narrator

text: which my lips have uttered and my mouth has spoken when I was in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he has done unto my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:
speaker: Narrator

text: But verily God has heard me; he has attended to the voice of my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer nor his mercy from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God be merciful unto us and bless us and cause his face to shine upon us. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thy way may be known upon the earth, thy saving health among all the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the peoples praise thee, O God; let all the peoples praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O let the Gentiles be glad and sing for joy, for thou shalt judge the people righteously and shepherd the Gentiles upon the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the peoples praise thee, O God; let all the peoples praise thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the earth bring forth her fruit, and God, even our own God, shall bless us.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shall bless us, and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered; let those that hate him flee before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As smoke is driven away; so drive them away: as wax melts before the fire, so shall the wicked perish at the presence of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the righteous shall be glad; they shall rejoice before God; they shall dance with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto God, sing psalms unto his name; extol him that rides upon the heavens by his name JAH and rejoice before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A father of the fatherless and a defender of the widows is God in his holy habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: God sets the solitary in families; he brings out those who are bound with chains, but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, when thou didst go forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped their rain at the presence of God; even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, by which thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy presence was in thy congregation; thou, O God, by thy goodness thou hast provided for the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall give a word; great shall be the host of the evangelists thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings of armies fled apace, and she that dwells in the house divided the spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though ye be cast among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver and her feathers with yellow gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Almighty scattered the kings that were in her, she became white as the snow in Salmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountain of Bashan is the mountain of God; the mountain of Bashan is a high mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why leap ye, ye high mountains? This is the mountain which God desires to dwell in; yea, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chariots of God are two thousand, thousands of angels; the Lord is among them as in Sinai, in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive; thou hast received gifts for men, yea, for the rebellious also that the LORD God might dwell among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord, who daily lades us with benefits, even the God of our saving health. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is our God is the God of salvation, and unto GOD the Lord belongs the way of escape from death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely God shall smite the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such a one as goes on still in his trespasses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy foot shall be dipped in the blood of thine enemies and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen thy ways, O God, even the ways of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; in between them were the virgins playing with timbrels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, ye of the lineage of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was little Benjamin as their ruler, the princes of Judah in their congregation, the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy God has commanded thy strength; confirm, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: From thy temple in Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reprehend the company of spearmen, the multitude of the strong, with the lords of the peoples, trampling them underfoot with their pieces of silver; Destroy thou the peoples that delight in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord, Selah:
speaker: Narrator

text: To him that rides upon the heavens of the heavens which were of old; behold, he shall send forth his voice, his mighty voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ascribe ye strength unto God; his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou art terrible out of thy sanctuaries; the God of Israel is he that gives strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sink in deep mire where there is no standing; I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am weary of my crying; my throat is dried; my eyes fail while I wait for my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; those that would destroy me, being my enemies wrongfully, are mighty; then I restored that which I did not take away.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou knowest my foolishness, and my guiltiness is not hid from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let those that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of the hosts, be ashamed for my sake; do not let those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame has covered my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am become a stranger unto my brethren and an alien unto my mother’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the zeal of thy house has consumed me, and the reproaches of those that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I wept with fasting of my soul, thou hast been a reproach unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I made sackcloth also my garment, and I became a proverb to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that sat in the gate spoke against me, and I was the song of the drunkards.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I corrected my prayer unto thee, O LORD, in the time of thy good pleasure; O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not drown; let me be delivered from those that hate me and out of the deep waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not the violent force of the waters overcome me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me, O LORD, for thy mercy is perceptible, look upon me according to the multitude of thy acts of compassion
speaker: Narrator

text: And hide not thy face from thy slave, for I am in trouble; hear me speedily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw near unto my soul and redeem it; deliver me because of my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast known my reproach and my shame and my dishonour; my adversaries are all before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reproach has broken my heart, and I am full of heaviness, and I looked for some to take pity, but there was no one, and for comforters, but I found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also gave me gall for my food; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their table become a snare before them, and that which should have been for their prosperity, let it become a stumbling block.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their eyes be darkened that they see not and make their loins continually to shake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their palace be desolate, and let no one dwell in their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten, and they boast that thou hast slain their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Add iniquity unto their iniquity, and let them not come into thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living and not be written with the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am poor and sorrowful; let thy saving health, O God, set me up on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the name of God with a song and will magnify him with praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: This also shall please the LORD better than the sacrifice of an ox or bullock that struggles with horns and hoofs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The humble shall see this and be glad; seek God and thy heart shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD hears the destitute and does not despise his prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the heavens and the earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moves in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God will protect Zion and will rebuild the cities of Judah; they shall dwell there and inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed of his slaves shall inherit it, and those that love his name shall dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my life; let them be turned backward and put to confusion that desire my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee, and let such as love thy saving health say continually, Let God be magnified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am poor and destitute; make haste unto me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O LORD, make no tarrying.
speaker: Narrator

text: In thee, O LORD, have I waited; let me not be forever put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me in thy righteousness and cause me to escape; incline thine ear unto me and save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou my strong habitation unto which I may continually resort; thou hast given a commandment that I should be saved because thou art my rock and my fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the perverse and violent man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD; thou art my security from my youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: By thee have I been sustained from the womb; thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels; my praise has been continually of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am as a wonder unto many, but thou art my strong refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy glory all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not cast me off in the time of old age; do not forsake me when my strength fails.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my enemies speak against me, and those that lay in wait for my soul take counsel together,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, God has forsaken him; persecute and take him for there is no one to deliver him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, be not far from me; O my God, make haste for my help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will continually wait and will add upon all thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall show forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day, for I know not the numbers thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD; I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth and until now; I shall manifest thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not until I have showed the strength of thy arm unto the next generation and thy power to every one that is to come,
speaker: Narrator

text: and thy righteousness, O God, unto excellence because thou hast done great things; O God, who is like unto thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou who hast caused me to see great and sore troubles, shalt return and quicken me and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt increase my greatness and comfort me on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also praise thee with an instrument of the psaltery, O my God; unto thee will I sing thy truth with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing praises unto thee and my soul, which thou hast ransomed.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner my tongue shall talk of thy righteousness every day, for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall judge thy people with righteousness and thy poor with judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains shall bring peace to the people and the little hills by righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall judge the poor of the people; he shall save the children of the destitute and shall break in pieces the violent.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall fear thee along with the sun and before the moon throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass as the dew that waters the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his days shall righteousness flourish and abundance of peace until there is no longer any moon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea and from the river unto the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him, and his enemies shall lick the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents; the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him; all Gentiles shall serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall deliver the destitute when he cries and the poor that has no helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall have mercy on the poor and destitute and shall save the souls of the poor in spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence, and precious shall their blood be in his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba; prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily he shall be given blessings.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be planted a handful of grain in the earth upon the tops of the mountains; its fruit shall thunder like Lebanon; and out of the city they shall blossom like the grass of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: His name shall endure for ever; before the sun his name shall be disseminated, and all Gentiles shall be blessed in him; they shall call him blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, the only one who does wondrous things
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed be his glorious name for ever, and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, my feet almost departed from the way; my steps had almost slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I became angry against the foolish when I saw the peace of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because there is no restraint that would bring about their death, but their strength is firm.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they are crowned with pride; they cover themselves with violence as a garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their eyes stand out with fatness; they easily obtain the desires of their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are lawless and speak wickedly of doing violence; they speak loftily.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set their mouth against heaven, and their tongue walks through the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore his people shall return here; and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they say, How does God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, these ungodly men, without being troubled by the world obtain riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, in vain have I cleansed my heart and washed my hands in innocency
speaker: Narrator

text: and been plagued all day long and chastened every morning:
speaker: Narrator

text: If I should say, I will speak as they do; behold, I should deny the generation of thy sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall meditate that I might understand this; it is very hard for me to see.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I come into the sanctuary of God, then I shall understand their end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places; in desolation thou shalt cause them to fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: How they are brought into desolation, as in a moment! They have come to an end; they are utterly consumed with terrors.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the dream of one who awakes; so, O Lord, when thou shalt rise up, thou shalt despise their appearances.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my kidneys.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I was ignorant and did not understand; I was as a beast before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless I was continually with thee; thou hast apprehended me by my right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast guided me with thy counsel, and afterward thou shalt receive me unto glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom have I in heaven but thee? And apart from thee there is nothing upon the earth that I desire.
speaker: Narrator

text: My flesh and my heart fail; the strength of my heart is that God is my portion for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, those that stray from thee shall perish; thou dost cut off all those that go a whoring from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, to draw near to God is good; I have put my hope in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? Why does thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed, this Mount Zion, in which thou hast dwelt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thy feet unto the eternal desolations, unto every enemy who has done wickedly in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine enemies have roared in the midst of thy assemblies; they set up their own banners for signs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Renowned, as one on the way to heaven, he who lifted up axes upon the thick trees for the work of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now they break down all the carved work thereof with axes and hammers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have set fire to thy sanctuaries; they have defiled the tabernacle of thy name in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them at once; they have burned up all the meeting places of the people of God in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: We no longer see our own banners; there is no longer any prophet: neither is there among us any that knows. How long shall this be?
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost thou withdraw thy hand, even thy right hand? Why dost thou hide it in thy bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my King from of old, he who works saving health in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength; thou didst break the heads of the dragons in the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst break the heads of leviathan in pieces and didst give him to be food to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the river; thou didst dry up mighty rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The day is thine, the night also is thine; thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth; thou hast made summer and winter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember this, that the enemy has spoken against the LORD and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the beasts; forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have respect unto the covenant; for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: O let not the oppressed return ashamed; the poor and destitute shall praise thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause; remember how the foolish man reproaches thee daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forget not the voices of thine enemies; the tumult of those that rise up against thee increases continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks, for that thy name is near, thy wondrous works declare.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I shall receive the congregation, I will judge uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth and all its inhabitants are dissolved; I bore up the pillars of it. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said unto the fools, Do not deal foolishly and to the wicked, Do not lift up the horn:
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not lift up your horn on high; speak not with a stiff neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: For promotion comes neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God is the judge; he puts down one and sets up another.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cup is in the hand of the LORD, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he pours out of the same; yea, the dregs thereof, shall wring out and swallow up all the wicked of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will cut off all the horns of the wicked, but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Judah is God known; his name is great in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Salem also is his tabernacle and his dwelling place in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he broke the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the war. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stouthearted are spoiled; they have slept their sleep; and nothing was found in the hands of the men of might.
speaker: Narrator

text: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, even thou, art to be feared, and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?
speaker: Narrator

text: From the heavens thou didst cause judgment to be heard; the earth feared and was still,
speaker: Narrator

text: when thou didst arise unto judgment, O God, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the wrath of man shall cause praise to come unto thee; the remainder of wrath shalt thou restrain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Vow and pay unto the LORD your God; let all that be round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall cut off the spirit of princes; he is terrible to the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord; my sore bled in the night and ceased not; my soul refused to be comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remembered God and cried out; I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst hold my eyelids open; I am broken and did not speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have considered the days from the beginning, the years of the ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call to remembrance my songs of the night; I commune with my own heart, and my spirit made diligent search.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is his mercy gone for ever? does his word fail from generation to generation?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has God forgotten to have mercy? has he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said, This is my infirmity, but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remembered the works of JAH; therefore I shall remember thy wonders of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: I meditated also on all thy works and spoke of thy doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy way, O God, is in holiness; who is so great a God as our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art the God that doest wonders; thou hast declared thy strength among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid; the depths also were troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clouds poured out floods of waters; the heavens thundered; thy bolts of lightning also went forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of thy thunder was all around; the lightnings lightened the world; the earth trembled and shook.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy way was in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps were not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst lead thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will open my mouth in a parable; I will utter enigmas of old,
speaker: Narrator

text: which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not hide them from their sons, showing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD and his strength and his wonderful works that he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he established a testimony in Jacob and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their sons:
speaker: Narrator

text: That the generation to come might know them, even the sons which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their sons
speaker: Narrator

text: that they might set their hope in God and not forget the works of God but keep his commandments
speaker: Narrator

text: and might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that did not set their heart aright and whose spirit was not steadfast with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not keep the covenant of God and refused to walk in his law
speaker: Narrator

text: and forgot his works and his wonders that he had showed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did marvellous things in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He divided the sea and caused them to pass through, and he made the waters to stand as a heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud and all the night with a light of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He clave the rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought streams also out of the rock and caused waters to run down like rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they tempted God in their heart by asking for food according to the desires of their soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they spoke against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he smote the rock that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the LORD heard this and was wroth, so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel
speaker: Narrator

text: because they had not believed God, nor had they trusted in his saving health;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he commanded the clouds of above and opened the doors of the heavens
speaker: Narrator

text: and caused manna to rain upon them to eat and gave them wheat of the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man did eat the food of the strong; he sent them food to the full.
speaker: Narrator

text: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven, and by his power he brought in the south wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He rained flesh also upon them as dust and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they did eat and were well filled; for he gave them their own desire;
speaker: Narrator

text: they were not estranged from their lust. But while their food was yet in their mouths,
speaker: Narrator

text: the wrath of God came upon them and slew the fattest of them and smote down the chosen of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all this they sinned still and did not give him credit for his wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he consumed their days in vanity and their years in tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he slew them, then they sought him, and they returned and enquired early after God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they remembered that God was their rock and the high God their redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless they flattered him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they steadfast in his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity and did not destroy them; many a time turned he his anger away and did not stir up all his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he remembered that they were but flesh: a wind that passes away and does not come again.
speaker: Narrator

text: How often did they provoke him in the wilderness and grieve him in the desert!
speaker: Narrator

text: And they turned back and tempted God and limited the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not remember his hand, nor the day when he ransomed them from anguish.
speaker: Narrator

text: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt and his wonders in the field of Zoan
speaker: Narrator

text: and had turned their rivers into blood and their floods, that they could not drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them, and frogs, which destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave also their fruits unto the caterpillar and their works unto the locust.
speaker: Narrator

text: He destroyed their vines with hail and their wild fig trees with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave up their cattle also to the hail and their flocks to thunderbolts of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation and trouble by sending evil angels among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a way to his anger; he did not spare their soul from death but gave their life over to the pestilence
speaker: Narrator

text: and smote all the firstborn in Egypt, the firstfruits of their strength in the tents of Ham:
speaker: Narrator

text: But made his own people to go forth like sheep and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not; but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought them into the borders of his holiness, into this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast out the Gentiles also before them and divided them an inheritance by line and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their habitations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God and did not keep his testimonies:
speaker: Narrator

text: But turned back and rebelled like their fathers; they became like a deceitful bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they provoked him to anger with their high places and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
speaker: Narrator

text: God heard this and was wroth and greatly abhorred Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent in which he dwelt among men
speaker: Narrator

text: and delivered his strength into captivity and his glory into the enemy’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave his people over also unto the sword and was wroth with his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fire consumed their young men; and their virgins were not honored in marriage songs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep and like a mighty man that shouts by reason of wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts; he put them to a perpetual reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he refused the tent of Joseph and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim:
speaker: Narrator

text: But chose the tribe of Judah, the Mount Zion which he loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built his sanctuary in preeminence like the earth which he has established for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He chose David also his slave and took him from the sheepfolds,
speaker: Narrator

text: from following the ewes great with young, he brought him to feed Jacob his people and Israel his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he fed them out of the integrity of his heart and guided them by the intelligence of his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, the Gentiles are come into thine inheritance; they have defiled the temple of thy holiness; they have laid Jerusalem on heaps.
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead bodies of thy slaves they have given to be food unto the fowls of the heavens, the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have shed their blood like water round about Jerusalem, and there was no one to bury them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are reproached by our neighbours, scorned, and derided by those that are round about us.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long, LORD? wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour out thy wrath upon the Gentiles that do not know thee and upon the kingdoms that do not call upon thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have devoured Jacob and laid waste his dwelling place.
speaker: Narrator

text: O remember not against us former iniquities; let thy tender mercies speedily meet us on the way, for we are very poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help us, O God, our saving health, for the honor of thy name and deliver us and purge away our sins, for thy name’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the Gentiles say, Where is their God? let him be known among the Gentiles in our sight by the revenging of the blood of thy slaves which is shed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sighing of the prisoners come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve those that are appointed to die
speaker: Narrator

text: and render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, with which they have reproached thee, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever: from generation to generation we will sing thy praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubim, shine forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength and come and save us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD God of the hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost feed them with the bread of tears and give them tears to drink in great measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost make us a strife unto our neighbours, and our enemies laugh at us among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us again, O God of the hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt; thou hast cast out the Gentiles and planted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst prepare room before it and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and its boughs were like the cedars of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: She sent out her boughs unto the sea and her branches unto the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all those who pass by the way pluck her?
speaker: Narrator

text: The boar out of the wood wastes it, and the wild beast of the field devours it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, we beseech thee, O God of the hosts: look down from heaven and behold and visit this vine
speaker: Narrator

text: and the vineyard which thy right hand has planted and the branch that thou didst make strong for thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is burned with fire; it is cut down; they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou didst make strong for thyself,
speaker: Narrator

text: so we will not go back from thee. Thou shalt quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us again, O LORD God of the hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing aloud unto God our strength; make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the song and play the timbrel, the harp of joy with the psaltery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blow the shofar in the new moon in the time appointed on our solemn feast day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is a statute of Israel and an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt where I heard a language that I did not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I removed his shoulder from the burden; his hands were delivered from working with clay.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst call in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder; I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee; O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me,
speaker: Narrator

text: no strange god shall be in thee, neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the LORD thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt; open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my people did not hearken to my voice, and Israel did not love me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I gave them up unto the hardness of their heart, and they walked in their own counsels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh, if my people would hearken unto me and Israel would walk in my ways!
speaker: Narrator

text: I would soon subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: The haters of the LORD would have submitted themselves unto him, and their time would endure for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God would have fed them also the finest of the wheat, and with honey out of the rock I would have satisfied thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: God stands in the congregation of the mighty; he judges among the gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will ye judge unjustly and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do right concerning the poor and fatherless; do justice to the poor and destitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver the poor and destitute; deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not know, neither do they understand; they walk in darkness; they move all the foundations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have said, Ye are gods; and all of you are sons of the most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall die like men and fall like one of the tyrants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O God, judge the earth, for thou shalt inherit all the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not keep silence, O God; do not hold thy peace, and do not be still, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, thine enemies make a tumult, and those that hate thee have lifted up their head.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have taken prudent counsel in secret against thy people and consulted against thy hidden ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have said, Come and let us cut them off from being a people that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they have consulted together with one consent; they are confederate against thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; of Moab and the Hagarenes;
speaker: Narrator

text: Gebal and Ammon and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
speaker: Narrator

text: Assur also is joined with them: they are an arm unto the sons of Lot. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do unto them as unto the Midianites, as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison,
speaker: Narrator

text: who perished at Endor; they became as dung for the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make them and their captains like Oreb and like Zeeb; all their princes as Zebah and as Zalmunna:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who have said, Let us inherit for ourselves the habitations of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, make them like a whirlwind, as the stubble before the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the fire burns a wood and as the flame sets the mountains on fire
speaker: Narrator

text: so persecute them with thy tempest and make them afraid with thy whirlwind.
speaker: Narrator
