text: Fill their faces with shame that they may seek thy name, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; let them be put to shame and perish
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may know that thou, whose name alone is LORD, art the most high over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: How amiable are thy habitations, O LORD of the hosts!
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of the LORD; my heart and my flesh sing to the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the sparrow has found a house and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young upon thine altars, O LORD of the hosts, my King and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are those that dwell in thy house; they shall continually praise thee. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the man whose strength is in thee, in whose heart are thy ways,
speaker: Narrator

text: who passing through the valley of Baca, shall make it a well; the rain also shall fill the pools.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go forth in a great multitude; and in order, they shall see God in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD God of the hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, O God our shield and look upon the face of thine anointed,
speaker: Narrator

text: for a day in thy courts is better than a thousand outside of them. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD God is a sun and shield unto us; the LORD will give grace and glory; he will not withhold good from those that walk uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD of the hosts, happy is the man that trusts in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, thou hast been favourable unto thy land; thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people; thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath; thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn us, O God our saving health and cause thine anger toward us to cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou extend thine anger from generation to generation?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou not give us life again that thy people may rejoice in thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Show us thy mercy, O LORD, and grant us thy saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will hear what God the LORD will speak, for he will speak peace unto his people and to his saints, that they not turn again to folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely his saving health is near those that fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truth shall spring out of the earth, and righteousness shall look down from the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall give that which is good, and our land shall bring forth her fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness shall go before him and shall set his steps in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow down thine ear, O LORD, hear me, for I am poor and needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve my soul; for I am merciful, O thou my God, save thy slave that trusts in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be merciful unto me, O Lord, for I cry unto thee daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice the soul of thy slave, for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, Lord, art good and ready to forgive and plenteous in mercy unto all those that call upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ear, O LORD, unto my prayer and attend to the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee, for thou wilt answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord, neither is there any other who does thy works.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Gentiles whom thou hast made shall come and humble themselves before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art great and doest wondrous things; thou alone art God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me thy way, O LORD; I will walk in thy truth; firm up my heart that I might fear thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart, and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For great is thy mercy upon me, and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest part of Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought after my soul and have not set thee before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O Lord, art a merciful and gracious God, longsuffering and plenteous in mercy and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O look into me and have mercy upon me; give thy strength unto thy slave and keep the son of thine handmaid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me a token for good that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed because thou, O LORD, hast helped me and comforted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: His foundation is in mountains of holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to those that know me; behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this one was born there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Zion it shall be said, This and that man were born in her; and the highest himself shall establish her.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall count when he writes up the peoples that this one was born there. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And singers and players on instruments in her shall say: all my springs are in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD God of my saving health, I cry day and night before Thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: let my prayer come before thee; incline thine ear unto my cry;
speaker: Narrator

text: for my soul is full of troubles, and my life draws near unto Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am counted with those that go down into the pit; I am as a man that has no strength:
speaker: Narrator

text: Freed among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou dost remember no more; and they are cut off from thy hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy wrath lies hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put away mine acquaintances far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them; I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eye mourns by reason of affliction; LORD, I have called daily upon thee; I have stretched out my hands unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou show wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall thy mercy be declared in the grave? or thy truth in hell?
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall thy wonder be known in darkness? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto thee have I cried, O LORD; and in the morning shall my prayer come before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, why dost thou cast off my soul? why dost thou hide thy face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I am afflicted and destitute; from my youth up I have feared thee and been in awe of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy fierce wrath goes over me; thy terrors have cut me off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast put lover and friend far from me, and placed my acquaintances into darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever; with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever in the heavens; in them thou shalt establish thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made a covenant with my chosen; I have sworn unto David my slave, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy seed will I establish for ever and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heavens shall praise thy wonder, O LORD, thy truth also in the congregation of the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who in the heavens can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?
speaker: Narrator

text: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints and to be had in reverence of all those that are about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD God of the hosts, who is like unto thee? Strong JAH, compassed about with thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost rule the raging of the sea: when its waves arise, thou dost still them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken Egypt in pieces as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: the world and its fullness, thou didst found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast created the north and the south; Tabor and Hermon shall sing in thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mighty arm is thine; strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy throne is composed of righteousness and judgment; mercy and truth go before thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are the people that know how to enter into joy; they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: In thy name shall they rejoice each day; and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art the glory of their strength, and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD is our shield, and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou didst speak in vision to thy holy one and didst say, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have found David my slave; I anointed him with the oil of my holiness,
speaker: Narrator

text: with whom my hand shall be established; mine arm also shall strengthen him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy shall not overcome him, nor the son of iniquity break him down.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will break down his foes before his face and smite those that hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my truth and my mercy shall be with him, and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner I will set his hand also in the sea and his right hand in the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall call me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will make him my firstborn, high above the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will keep my mercy for him for ever, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also make his seed to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: If his sons forsake my law and do not walk in my judgments,
speaker: Narrator

text: if they profane my statutes and do not keep my commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will visit their rebellion with the rod and their iniquity with stripes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless I will not take my mercy from him, neither will I falsify my truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not profane my covenant, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.
speaker: Narrator

text: His seed shall endure for ever and his throne as the sun before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be established for ever as the moon and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast cast off and abhorred thine anointed; thou hast been wroth with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy slave; thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that pass by the way spoil him; he is a reproach to his neighbours.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast also blunted the edge of his sword and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made his clarity to cease and cast his throne down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of his youth hast thou shortened; thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long, O LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember how short my time is; why hast thou made all men subject to vanity?
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is he that lives and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of Sheol? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, where are thy former mercies, which thou didst sware unto David in thy truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy slaves; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of many peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text: because thine enemies have dishonoured, O LORD; they have dishonoured the footsteps of thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD for ever. Amen and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, thou hast been our refuge from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost turn unto man until he is broken and thou saith, Become converted, ye sons of Adam.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past and as a watch in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost cause them to pass by as the waters of a river; they are as a dream, which is strong in the morning like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning it blossoms and grows up; in the evening it is cut down and withers.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath we are troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all our days decline because of thy wrath; we end our years according to the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of our years are seventy, and of the most valiant eighty years, yet their strength is labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who knows the power of thine anger? that thy wrath is not less than our fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause us to learn this that we might number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return unto us, O LORD, how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: O satisfy us early with thy mercy, and we shall sing and be glad all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make us glad according to the days in which thou hast afflicted us and the years in which we have seen evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy work appear in thy slaves and thy glory upon their sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us, and set thou aright the work of our hands upon us; yea, set thou aright the work of our hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that dwells in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say of the LORD, He is my hope and my fortress: my God; in him will I secure myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler and from the mortal pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings thou shalt be secure: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night, nor for the arrow that flies by day,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor for the pestilence that walks in darkness, nor for the destruction that wastes at noonday.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thousands shall fall at thy side and ten thousands at thy right hand, but it shall not come near thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely with thine eyes thou shalt behold and see the reward of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hast made the LORD, who is my hope, even the most High, thy habitation,
speaker: Narrator

text: no evil shall befall thee, neither shall any plague come near thy dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall give his angels charge over thee to keep thee in all thy ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall bear thee up in their hands lest thy foot stumble against a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder; the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he has set his will upon me, therefore I will deliver him; I will set him on high because he has known my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him and glorify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: With long life I will satisfy him and show him my saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:
speaker: Narrator

text: To show forth thy mercy in the morning and thy faithfulness every night
speaker: Narrator

text: upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the psaltery, upon the harp with a pleasant sound.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, O LORD, hast made me glad with thy work; I will delight in the works of thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: A carnal man does not know, neither does a fool understand this:
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked spring forth as the grass, and all the workers of iniquity blossom, so that they shall be destroyed for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O LORD, art most high for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, thine enemies, O LORD, for behold, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of a unicorn; I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my eye saw my desire on my enemies, and my ears heard my desire of those that rose up against me, of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree; he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that are planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be vigorous and flourishing
speaker: Narrator

text: to show that the LORD is upright; he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD reigns; he has clothed himself with majesty; the LORD has clothed himself with strength; he has girded himself: he has established the world also, that it cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: From this time on, thy throne shall never be moved; thou art eternal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rivers have lifted up, O LORD; the rivers have lifted up their voice; the rivers lift up their waves.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD on high is mightier than the noise of many waters, yea, than the mighty waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies are very sure; holiness becomes thy house, O LORD, for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongs; O God, to whom vengeance belongs, show thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?
speaker: Narrator

text: They break in pieces thy people, O LORD, and afflict thy heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text: They slay the widow and the stranger and murder the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they say, JAH shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand, ye carnal ones among the people, and, ye fools, when will ye be wise?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that chastens the Gentiles, shall he not correct? he that teaches man knowledge, shall not he know?
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD knows the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man whom thou dost chasten, O JAH, and teach him out of thy law,
speaker: Narrator

text: to cause him to rest in the days of adversity, until the pit is dug for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the judgment shall be returned unto righteousness, and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul would have quickly dwelt with the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I said, My foot slips, thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the multitude of my thoughts within me, thy comforts delight my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, who creates toil under the guise of law?
speaker: Narrator

text: They gather themselves together as an army against the life of the righteous and condemn the innocent blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD is my refuge, and my God is the rock of my trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: O come, let us bring joy unto the LORD; let us sing with joy unto the rock of our saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving and sing unto him with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD is a great God and a great King above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his hand are the deep places of the earth; the heights of the mountains are his also.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea is his, and he made it; and his hands formed the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: O come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the LORD our maker.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. Today if ye will hear his voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: harden not your heart, as in the provocation and as in the day of trials in the wilderness
speaker: Narrator

text: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty years long I was grieved with this generation and said, It is a people that err from the heart, who have not known my ways;
speaker: Narrator

text: unto whom I swore in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: O sing unto the LORD a new song; sing unto the LORD, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the LORD, bless his name; show forth his saving health from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare his glory among the Gentiles, his wonders among all peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD is great and greatly to be praised; he is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour and majesty are before him; strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the LORD, O ye kindreds of the peoples, give unto the LORD the glory and the strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name; bring offerings, and come into his courts.
speaker: Narrator

text: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness; fear before him, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say among the Gentiles that the LORD reigns; he also has established the world, it shall not be moved; he shall judge the peoples righteously.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar and the fullness thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the field be joyful and all that is therein; then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice
speaker: Narrator

text: before the LORD; for he has come, for he has come to judge the earth; he shall judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with his truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD reigns; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Clouds and darkness are round about him; righteousness and judgment are the seat of his throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fire shall go before him and burn up his enemies round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: His lightnings enlightened the world; the earth saw and trembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all those that serve graven images be confounded, those that boast of idols; worship him, all ye gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zion heard and was glad; and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou, O LORD, art high above all the earth; thou art exalted far above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that love the LORD are to hate evil; he preserves the souls of his saints; he delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Light is sown for the righteous and gladness for the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the LORD, ye righteous, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O sing unto the LORD a new song; for he has done marvellous things; his right hand has gotten him the victory, even the arm of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has made known his saving health; he has openly showed his righteousness in the sight of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the saving health of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing with joy unto the LORD, all the earth; lift up thy voice and rejoice and sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises unto the LORD with the harp, with the harp and the voice of a song.
speaker: Narrator

text: With trumpets and the sound of the shofar make a joyful noise before the LORD, the King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sea roar and the fullness thereof, the world and those that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the rivers clap their hands; let the mountains be joyful together
speaker: Narrator

text: before the LORD; for he has come to judge the earth; with righteousness he shall judge the world and the peoples with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD reigns; the peoples shall tremble; he who sits above the cherubim reigns; the earth shall be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is great in Zion, and he is high above all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise thy great and terrible name, for it is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king’s strength is that he loves judgment; thou dost establish equity; thou dost execute judgment and righteousness in Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt ye the LORD our God and worship at the footstool of his feet, which is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron are among his priests and Samuel among those that call upon his name; they called upon the LORD, and he answered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke unto them in the pillar of fire; they kept his testimonies and the order that he gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst answer them, O LORD our God; thou wast a God that didst forgive them, and an avenger for their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Exalt the LORD our God and worship at the mountain of his holiness, for the LORD our God is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the LORD with gladness; come before his presence with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye that the LORD he is God; it is he that has made us and not we ourselves; we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving and into his courts with praise; be thankful unto him and bless his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endures to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing of mercy and judgment; unto thee, O LORD, will I sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt come unto me, I will walk in the way of perfection and understand. I will walk in the midst of my house in the perfection of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set nothing of Belial before my eyes: I hate the work of those that betray; it shall not cleave to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will not know a wicked person.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever secretly slanders his neighbour, I will cut off; he that has a high look and a proud heart I will not suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he that walks in the way of perfection, he shall serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that works deceit shall not dwell within my house; he that tells lies shall not tarry in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land, that I may cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me; in the day when I call, answer me speedily.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as in a hearth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is smitten and withered like grass so that I forget to eat my bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: By reason of the voice of my groaning, my bones cleave to my skin.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I am like an owl of the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: I watch and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
speaker: Narrator

text: My enemies reproach me all the day, and those that are mad against me are sworn against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have eaten ashes like bread and mingled my drink with weeping,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of thine indignation and thy wrath; for thou hast lifted me up and cast me down.
speaker: Narrator

text: My days are like a shadow that declines, and I am withered like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O LORD, shalt endure for ever and thy remembrance unto all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt arise and have mercy upon Zion; for the time to favour her, the set time, is come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy slaves love her stones and have compassion on the dust thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Gentiles shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth thy glory
speaker: Narrator

text: because the LORD shall have built up Zion, and he shall be seen in his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall have regarded the prayer of those who are alone and destitute and not despised their prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be written for the generation to come, and the people who shall be created shall praise JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from the heavens the LORD beheld the earth
speaker: Narrator

text: to hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they might declare the name of the LORD in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: when the people are gathered together as one and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, O my God, do not cut me off in the midst of my days; thy years are from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of old thou hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the work of thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture thou shalt change them, and they shall be changed:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of thy slaves shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless the name of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who forgives all thine iniquities; who heals all thy diseases;
speaker: Narrator

text: who redeems thy life from destruction; who crowns thee with mercy and compassion;
speaker: Narrator

text: who satisfies thy mouth with good things so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD executes righteousness and justice unto all that suffer violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not always chide, neither will he keep his anger for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has not dealt with us after our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the heavens are high above the earth so does he increase his mercy over those that fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our rebellions from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like as a father has mercy upon his children, so the LORD has mercy upon those that fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he knows our frame; he remembers that we are dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for man, his days are as grass; as an open flower of the field, so he blossoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wind passes over it, and it is gone, and its place shall know it no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon those that fear him, and his righteousness unto the children’s children,
speaker: Narrator

text: to such as keep his covenant and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has prepared his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom rules over all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the LORD, ye his angels, valiant and strong, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless ye the LORD, all ye his hosts, ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty,
speaker: Narrator

text: who dost cover thyself with light as with a garment, who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain,
speaker: Narrator

text: who dost establish his chambers between the waters, who makes the clouds his chariot, who walks upon the wings of the wind,
speaker: Narrator

text: who makes his angels spirits, his ministers a flaming fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be moved by any age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst cover it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains were exposed; they descended through the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over, that they not turn again to cover the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art he who sends the springs into the valleys, which run among the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: They give drink to every beast of the field; the wild asses quench their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them the fowls of the heavens have their habitation; they sing among the leaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He waters the mountains from his chambers; the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.
speaker: Narrator

text: He causes the hay to grow for the cattle and grass for the service of man, that he may bring forth bread out of the earth
speaker: Narrator

text: and wine that makes glad the heart of man, making his face to shine with oil and bread which sustains man’s heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The trees of the LORD are satisfied; the cedars of Lebanon, which he has planted,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the birds may make their nests there: the stork makes her house among the fir trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high mountains are a refuge for the wild goats, and the rocks for the conies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed the moon for times and seasons; the sun knows his going down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou makest darkness, and it is night, wherein all the beasts of the forest move.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions roar after their prey and seek their food from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun arises, they withdraw and lay themselves down in their dens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man goes forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom thou hast made them all; the earth is full of thy riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are innumerable creeping things, both small and great beasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: There go the ships; there is that leviathan, whom thou didst make to play therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: These wait all upon thee, that thou may give them their food in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou givest unto them, they gather; thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled; thou takest away their spirit, they cease to exist and return to their dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created; and thou renewest the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the glory of the LORD endure for ever; let the LORD rejoice in his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: He looks on the earth, and it trembles: he touches the mountains, and they smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
speaker: Narrator

text: My meditation of him shall be sweet; I will be glad in the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the LORD, O my soul. Halelu- JAH (Praise ye the LORD).
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name; make known his deeds among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him; speak of all his wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glory in his holy name; let the heart of those that seek the LORD rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seek the LORD and his strength; seek his face continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember his marvellous works that he has done, his wonders and the judgments of his mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye seed of Abraham his slave, ye sons of Jacob his chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded for a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text: which covenant he made with Abraham and his oath unto Isaac
speaker: Narrator

text: and confirmed the same unto Jacob by decree, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:
speaker: Narrator

text: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance,
speaker: Narrator

text: when they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went from nation to nation from one kingdom to another people,
speaker: Narrator

text: he suffered no man to do them wrong; yea, he chastened kings for their sakes:
speaker: Narrator

text: Saying, Touch not mine anointed and do my prophets no harm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land; he broke the whole staff of bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a slave,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose feet they hurt with fetters; his soul was laid in iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until the time that his word came, the spoken word of the LORD purified him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king sent and loosed him, the ruler of the people let him go free.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made him lord of his house and ruler of all his substance:
speaker: Narrator

text: To bind his princes at his pleasure and teach his elders wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterwards Israel entered into Egypt, and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he increased his people greatly and made them stronger than their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned their heart to hate his people to think evil against his slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent Moses his slave and Aaron whom he had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the words of his signs in them and his wonders in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent darkness and made it dark, and they did not rebel against his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned their waters into blood and slew their fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance in the chambers of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke, and swarms of flies and lice came within all their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned their rain into hail, into flaming fire in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: He smote their vines also and their fig trees and broke the trees within their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke, and the locusts came and caterpillars without number,
speaker: Narrator

text: and ate up all the grass in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought them forth with silver and gold, and there was not one sick person among their tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Egypt was glad when they departed, for the fear of them fell upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spread a cloud for a covering and fire to give light in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people asked, and he brought quails and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places and became a river.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he remembered his holy word with Abraham his slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought forth his people with joy and his chosen with singing
speaker: Narrator

text: and gave them the lands of the Gentiles, and they inherited the labour of the nations,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they might observe his statutes and keep his laws. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good, for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? Who can show forth all his praise?
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are those that keep judgment and he that does righteousness at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou dost bear unto thy people; O visit me with thy saving health,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity; we have done wickedly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers did not understand thy wonders in Egypt; they did not remember the multitude of thy mercies but rebelled by the sea, even at the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
speaker: Narrator

text: He reprehended the Red Sea also, and it was dried up, so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they believed his words; they sang his praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: They became rash. They soon forgot his works; they waited not for his counsel:
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave themselves over to lust in the wilderness and tempted God in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave them their request, but sent leanness into their soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they envied Moses in the camp and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and covered the company of Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made a calf in Horeb and worshipped the molten image.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eats grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: They forgot the God of their saving health, who had done great things in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things upon the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath lest he should destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they despised the pleasant land; they did not believe his word:
speaker: Narrator

text: But murmured in their tents and did not hearken unto the voice of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: to overthrow their seed also among the Gentiles, and to scatter them in the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also joined themselves unto Baalpeor and ate the sacrifices for the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions; and the plague broke in upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Phinehas stood up and executed judgment, and so the plague was stayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that was counted unto him for righteousness from generation to generation for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they provoked his spirit to rebel, and he spoke it with his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:
speaker: Narrator

text: But were mingled among the Gentiles and learned their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they served their idols, which were a snare unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils
speaker: Narrator

text: and shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was polluted with blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they were defiled with their own works and went a whoring with their own inventions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave them into the hand of the Gentiles, and those that hated them ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their enemies oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He delivered them many times, but they rebelled at his counsel and were brought low for their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless he would look upon their affliction and hear their cry
speaker: Narrator

text: and remember his covenant with them and repent according to the multitude of his mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also caused those that carried them captives to have mercy upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the Gentiles, that we might lift up thy holy name, that we might glory in thy praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting; and let all the people say, Amen. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he has redeemed from the hand of the enemy
speaker: Narrator

text: and gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
speaker: Narrator

text: They wandered lost in the wilderness, alone and out of the way; they found no city to dwell in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
speaker: Narrator

text: For he satisfies the soul that is destitute and fills the hungry soul with goodness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and in irons,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they rebelled against the words of God and condemned the counsel of the most High:
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death and broke their bonds asunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has broken the gates of brass and cut the bars of iron asunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fools, because of the way of their rebellion, and because of their iniquities, were afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their soul abhorred all manner of food, and they drew near unto the gates of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent his word and healed them and delivered them from their graves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them offer the sacrifices of praise and publish his works with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that go down to the sea in ships that do work in many waters,
speaker: Narrator

text: these have seen the works of the LORD and his wonders in the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he commands and raises the stormy wind, which lifts up its waves.
speaker: Narrator

text: They mount up to the heavens; they go down again to the depths; their soul is melted because of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: They reel to and fro and stagger like a drunken man, and all of their knowledge is of no avail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivers them out of their afflictions.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes the storm a calm, so that its waves are still.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they are glad because they are at rest; so he brings them into the haven of his will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his mercy and for his wonderful works unto the sons of Adam!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned rivers into a wilderness and the watersprings into dry ground;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fruitful land into salt flats, because of the wickedness of those that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turns the wilderness into reservoirs of water and dry ground into watersprings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there he makes the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation
speaker: Narrator

text: and sow the fields and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: He blesses them also, so that they are multiplied greatly and suffers not their cattle to decrease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, they are diminished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He pours contempt upon princes and causes them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he sets the poor on high from affliction and makes his families like a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall see it and rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is wise and will observe these things and shall understand the mercies of the LORD?
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise; this is my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, psaltery and harp; I will awake the dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the peoples, and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy mercy is great above the heavens, and thy truth reaches unto the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens and thy glory above all the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: that thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem and mete out the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gilead shall be mine; Manasseh shall be mine; Ephraim also shall be the strength of my head; Judah shall be my lawgiver;
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab shall be my washpot; over Edom I will cast my shoe; over Philistia I will triumph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thou, O God, who had cast us off and did not, O God, go forth with our hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give us help from trouble; for the salvation of man is deception.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through God we shall do valiantly, for he shall tread down our enemies again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not hold thy peace, O God of my praise;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me; they have spoken of me with a lying tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: They compassed me about with words of hatred and fought against me without a cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have responded to my love by becoming my adversaries, but I give myself unto prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set thou the wicked man over him, and let Satan stand at his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned, and let his prayer become sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his days be few, and let another take his office.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his children be continually vagabonds and beg; let them seek their bread out of their desolate places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the extortioner catch all that he has, and let the strangers spoil his labour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let there be no one to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his posterity be cut off, and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD, and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he did not remember to show mercy but persecuted the man who is poor in spirit and destitute and broken in heart, that he might slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he loved the curse, so let it come unto him; as he delighted not in the blessing, so let it be far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he clothed himself with the curse like as with his garment, and it entered into his bowels like water and like oil into his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let it be unto him as the garment which covers him and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let this be the reward from the LORD of those who spoke falsely against me and of those that speak evil against my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou, O GOD the Lord, do unto me for thy name’s sake; because thy mercy is good, deliver me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am gone like the shadow when it declines; I am tossed up and down by the wind as the locust.
speaker: Narrator

text: My knees are weak through fasting, and my flesh fails for lack of fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have become a reproach unto them; when they looked upon me they shook their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help me, O LORD my God; O save me according to thy mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they may know that this is thy hand, that thou, O LORD, hast done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them curse, but bless thou; when they arise, let them be ashamed, but let thy slave rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who speak evil against me falsely be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion as with a mantle.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor in spirit to save his soul from those that judge him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion; rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauty of holiness; as the dew which falls from the womb of the morning, thus shall those who are thine be born unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has sworn and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord at thy right hand shall smite the kings in the day of his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall judge among the Gentiles; he shall fill their places with dead bodies; he shall wound the head over much of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall drink of the brook in the way; therefore he shall lift up his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, Beth in the company and in the congregation of the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: The works of the LORD are great, Daleth sought out by all those that have pleasure therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and beauty are his work; Vau and his righteousness endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has made his wonderful works to be remembered;
The LORD is gracious and merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has given sustenance unto those that fear him; Jod He will ever be mindful of his covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has shown his people the power of his works,
by giving them the inheritance of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The works of his hands are truth and judgment;
all his commandments are sure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They stand fast from age to age
and are made in truth and uprightness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Halelu-JAH. Blessed is the man that fears the LORD,
that delights greatly in his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His seed shall be mighty upon earth;
the generation of the upright shall be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wealth and riches shall be in his house;
and his righteousness endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A light has shined in the darkness upon the upright:
Gracious and merciful and righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A good man has mercy and lends;
He will govern his affairs with good judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely he shall not be moved for ever;
the righteous shall be in eternal remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall not be afraid of evil rumours;
his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His heart is established; he shall not be afraid,
until he sees his desire upon his enemies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. Praise, O ye slaves of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, the LORD’s name is to be praised.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is high above all Gentiles and his glory above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is like unto the LORD our God, who dwells on high,
speaker: Narrator

text: who humbles himself to behold the things that are in heaven and in the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: He raises up the poor out of the dust and lifts the destitute out of the dunghill;
speaker: Narrator

text: that he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes the barren woman to keep house and to be a joyful mother of sons. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah was his holiness, and Israel his dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea saw it and fled; Jordan was driven back.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains skipped like rams and the little hills like lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text: What came upon thee, O thou sea, that thou didst flee? And thou O Jordan, that thou wast driven back?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye mountains, why didst ye skip like rams and ye little hills, like lambs?
speaker: Narrator

text: At the presence of the Lord, the earth trembles, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text: who turned the rock into a reservoir of water, the flint into a fountain of waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy and for thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the Gentiles say, Where is now their God?
speaker: Narrator

text: But our God is in the heavens; he has made whatever he has desired.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have mouths, but they shall never speak; they have eyes, but they shall never see:
speaker: Narrator

text: They have ears, but they shall never hear; they have noses, but they shall never smell;
speaker: Narrator

text: they have hands, but they shall never touch; they have feet, but they shall never walk; they shall never speak through their throat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those that make them become like unto them, and every one that trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD; he is your help and your shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD; he is your help and your shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD; he is your help and your shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will greatly bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will bless those that fear the LORD, both small and great.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall increase his blessing upon you more and more, upon you and your sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are blessed of the LORD who made the heavens and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens are the heavens of the LORD, but the earth he has given to the sons of Adam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead shall not praise JAH, neither any that go down into silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will bless JAH from this time forth and for evermore. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love the LORD, because he has heard my voice and my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he has inclined his ear unto me, therefore I will call upon him all of my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sorrows of death compassed me and the pains of Sheol found me; I encountered trouble and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I called upon the name of the LORD, saying, O LORD, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD preserves the simple; I was brought low, and he saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return unto thy rest, O my soul, for the LORD has dealt bountifully with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: I believed, therefore I spoke, and was greatly afflicted;
speaker: Narrator

text: I said in my haste, All men are liars.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall I render unto the LORD for all his benefits toward me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will take the cup of saving health and invoke the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his merciful ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is so, O LORD, because I am thy slave; I am thy slave, the son of thine handmaid; thou hast loosed my bonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will offer unto thee the sacrifice of praise and will invoke the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the courts of the LORD’s house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: O praise the LORD, all ye Gentiles; praise him, all ye peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has greatly increased his mercy upon us; and the truth of the LORD endures for ever. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good because his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel now say that his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those that fear the LORD say now, that his mercy is eternal.
speaker: Narrator

text: From a tight place I called upon JAH; and JAH answered me and set me in a wide place.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is for me; I will not fear what man can do unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD takes my part with those that help me; therefore I shall see my desire upon those that hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to wait upon the LORD than to wait upon man.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the nations compassed me about; but in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They compassed me about; yea, they laid hold of me; but in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: They compassed me about like bees; they were quenched as the fire of thorns; for in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast thrust at me with violence that I might fall, but the LORD helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text: JAH is my strength and song and is become my saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of singing and saving health is in the tents of the righteous; the right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The right hand of the LORD is exalted; the right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall not die, but live and declare the works of JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: JAH has chastened me sore, but he has not given me over unto death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open unto me the gates of righteousness; I will go in through them; I will praise JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: This gate is of the LORD; the righteous shall enter in.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee; for thou hast heard me and art become my saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the LORD’s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the day which the LORD has made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD; O LORD, I beseech thee, cause us now to prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be he that comes in the name of the LORD; from the house of the LORD we bless you.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is the LORD, who has shined on us; bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee; thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good, for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are those who walk in the perfect way, who walk in the law of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are those that keep his testimonies and that seek him with their whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who do no iniquity walk in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.
speaker: Narrator

text: O that my ways were ordered to keep thy statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I shall not be ashamed, when I have insight unto all thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will keep thy statutes; O do not utterly forsake me.
speaker: Narrator

text: With what shall a young man cleanse his way? when he shall keep thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my whole heart I have sought thee; O let me not err from thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy spoken word have I hid in my heart that I might not sin against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my lips I have declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies as above all riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will meditate in thy precepts and consider thy ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will delight myself in thy statutes; I will not forget thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deal bountifully with thy slave that I may live and keep thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open my eyes, and I shall behold the wonders of thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a stranger in the earth; hide not thy commandments from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is broken from desiring thy judgments at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast reprehended the proud; cursed are those who err from thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove from me reproach and contempt, for I have kept thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Princes also sat and spoke against me as thy slave spoke according to thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy testimonies are my delight and my counsellors.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul cleaves unto the dust; quicken me according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have declared my ways, and thou didst hear me; teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts; so I shall meditate of thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul melts for heaviness; strengthen me according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove from me the way of lying, and from thy law grant me mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have chosen the way of truth; I have laid thy judgments before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have stuck unto thy testimonies; O LORD, put me not to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will run the way of thy commandments when thou shalt enlarge my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes, and I shall keep it unto the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments, for therein do I delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies and not to covetousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn away my eyes from beholding vanity, and cause me to live in thy way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Confirm thy word unto thy slave, who is devoted to thy fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn away my reproach which I have feared, for thy judgments are good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts; cause me to live in thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy mercy come unto me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy spoken word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I shall answer him that reproaches me, by saying that I trust in thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take not at any time the word of truth out of my mouth; for I wait for thy judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall I keep thy law continually from age to age.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will walk at liberty, for I sought thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings and will not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lift up My hands unto thy commandments, which I have loved, and I will meditate in thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the word unto thy slave, in which thou hast caused me to wait.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is my comfort in my affliction; for thy spoken word has caused me to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have had me greatly in derision; yet I have not deviated from thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD, and have consoled myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Horror has taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: My portion, O LORD, I have said, will be to keep thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: I intreated thy presence with my whole heart; be merciful unto me according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I considered my ways and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I made haste and did not delay to keep thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: The company of the wicked have robbed me, but I have not forgotten thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of the judgments of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a companion of all those that fear thee and of those that keep thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy and teaches me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast dealt well with thy slave, O LORD, according unto thy word,
speaker: Narrator

text: which teaches me discernment and knowledge, for I have believed thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before I was humbled, I went into error, but now I keep thy spoken word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art good and doest good; teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have forged a lie against me, but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their heart became fat like grease, but I delight in thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was good for me that I have been humbled, that I might learn thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me; give me understanding, and I shall learn thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that fear thee will be glad when they see me because I have waited on thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let, I pray thee, thy mercy be for my comfort, according to thy spoken word unto thy slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy mercy come unto me, that I may live, for thy law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the proud be ashamed, for they dealt perversely with me without a cause, but I will meditate in thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those that fear thee turn unto me and those that have known thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes that I not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul faints with desire for thy salvation as I await thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes fail for thy spoken word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am become like a wine skin in the smoke; yet I have not forgotten thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: How many are the days of thy slave? When wilt thou execute judgment on those that persecute me?
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have dug pits for me, but they do not proceed according to thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy commandments are of the same truth; they persecute me wrongfully; help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have almost consumed me upon earth, but I have not forsaken thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to live according to thy mercy, so I shall keep the testimony of thy mouth.
