speaker: Narrator

text: For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy truth is from generation to generation; thou hast established the earth, and it perseveres.
speaker: Narrator

text: They persevere unto this day by thy ordinance; for they are all thy slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless thy law had been my delight, I should have perished in my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will never forget thy precepts; for with them thou hast caused me to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am thine, keep me; for I have sought thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me, but I will consider thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen an end of all perfection, but thy commandment is exceeding broad.
speaker: Narrator

text: O how I love thy law! it is my meditation all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies, for they are eternal unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have more understanding than all my teachers, for thy testimonies have been my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I understand more than the elders because I keep thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not departed from thy judgments, for thou hast taught me.
speaker: Narrator

text: How sweet have been thy spoken words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text: Through thy precepts I have obtained understanding; therefore I have hated every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my way.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep the judgments of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am afflicted very much; cause me to live, O LORD, according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is continually in my hand; yet I do not forget thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked have laid a snare for me; yet did not I err from thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have taken thy testimonies as a heritage for ever; for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes always, even unto the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate vain thoughts; but I love thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my hiding place and my shield; I have waited for thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart from me, ye evildoers; for I will keep the commandments of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uphold me according unto thy word, and I shall live; and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold me up, and I shall be saved, and I shall delight in thy statutes continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast trodden down all those that err from thy statutes; for their deceit is falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost cause all the wicked of the earth to come undone like dross; therefore I have loved thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: My flesh trembles for fear of thee, and I am afraid of thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have complied with judgment and righteousness; do not leave me to my oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be surety for thy slave for good; do not let the proud do violence unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine eyes fail for thy saving health and for the spoken word of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deal with thy slave according to thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am thy slave; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is time for thee, O LORD, to act; for they have dissipated thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have loved thy commandments above gold, yea, above fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have esteemed all thy precepts concerning all things to be right and I have hated every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies are wonderful; therefore does my soul keep them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The exposition of thy words gives light; it gives understanding unto the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text: I opened my mouth and panted; for I longed for thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look thou upon me and be merciful unto me, as thou didst use to do unto those that love thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Order my steps with thy word; and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ransom me from the violence of men, and I will keep thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make thy face to shine upon thy slave and teach me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rivers of waters ran down my eyes because they did not keep thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast commanded righteousness, which consists of thy testimonies and thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My zeal has consumed me, because my enemies have forgotten thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy word is very pure; therefore thy slave loves it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am small and despised; yet I have not forgotten thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy righteousness is eternal righteousness, and thy law is the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trouble and anguish found me; but thy commandments were my delights.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy testimonies are eternal righteousness; give me understanding, and I shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried with my whole heart; answer me, O LORD, and I will keep thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I arose before the dawning of the morning and cried: I waited in thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes anticipate the night watches that I might meditate in thy spoken word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my voice according to thy mercy; O LORD, cause me to live according to thy judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that persecute me draw near unto evil; they have strayed from thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider my affliction and deliver me; for I have not forgotten thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Plead my cause and redeem me; quicken me according to thy spoken word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saving health is far from the wicked, for they do not seek thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are thy tender mercies, O LORD: cause me to live according to thy judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are my persecutors and my enemies; yet I do not deviate from thy testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beheld the transgressors and was grieved because they did not keep thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider, O LORD, that I love thy precepts; cause me to live according to thy mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The beginning of thy word is truth, and every one of the judgments of thy righteousness is eternal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Princes have persecuted me without a cause, but my heart stands in awe of thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoice at thy spoken word, as one that finds great spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate and abhor lying, but I love thy law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of the judgments of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who love thy law have great peace, and nothing shall cause them to stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, I have waited for thy saving health and done thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul has kept thy testimonies, and I have loved them exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies, for all my ways are before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD; give me understanding according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my supplication come before thee; deliver me according to thy spoken word.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips shall overflow with praise when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue shall speak thy words; for all thy commandments are righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thine hand help me, for I have chosen thy precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have longed for thy saving health, O LORD, and thy law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee, and let thy judgments help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy slave; for I have not forgotten thy commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he answered me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips and from a deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?
speaker: Narrator

text: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul has long dwelt with those that hate peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am for peace; but when I speak, they are for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains, from whence cometh my help.
speaker: Narrator

text: My help comes from the LORD, who made the heavens and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved; he that keeps thee will not slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he that keeps Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is thy keeper: the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil; he shall preserve thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our feet stood within thy gates, O Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem, that one which is built as a city that is well united together
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the tribes went up there, the tribes of JAH, the testimony to Israel, to praise the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there are set thrones of the judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem; those that love thee shall be brought into rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace be within thy walls and rest within thy palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my brethren and companions’ sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek thy good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee I lift up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, as the eyes of slaves look unto the hand of their masters and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress, so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until he shall have mercy upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us, for we are exceedingly weary of being held in contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul is exceedingly weary of the scorning of those that are at ease and of the contempt of the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the LORD had not been for us, now may Israel say,
speaker: Narrator

text: If the LORD had not been for us, when men rose up against us,
speaker: Narrator

text: then they would have swallowed us up alive, when their wrath was kindled against us;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the waters would have overwhelmed us; the flood would have gone over our soul;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD, who did not give us as a prey to their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; the snare has broken, and we are escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made the heaven and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that trust in the LORD are as Mount Zion, which cannot be removed but abides for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the LORD is round about his people from now on even for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the rod of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous because the righteous shall not put forth their hands unto iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do good, O LORD, unto those that are good and to those that are upright in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the LORD shall take them away with the workers of iniquity; and peace shall be upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the LORD shall turn again the captivity of Zion, we shall be like those that dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then our mouth shall be filled with laughter and our tongue with singing; then they shall say among the Gentiles, The LORD has done great things with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has done great things with us, of which we shall be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that sow with tears shall reap with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that goes forth and weeps, bearing the precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless the LORD builds the house, they labour in vain that build it; unless the LORD keeps the city, the watchmen watch in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is vain for you to rise up early, to come home late, to eat the bread of sorrows, because he shall give his beloved sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, sons are a heritage of the LORD, and the fruit of the womb is to be desired.
speaker: Narrator

text: As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the young men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the man that has filled his quiver with them: he shall not be ashamed when he speaks with the enemies in the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is every one that fears the LORD, that walks in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands; happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thy house; thy children like olive plants round about thy table.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that fears the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall bless thee out of Zion, and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, thou shalt see thy children’s children and peace upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:
speaker: Narrator

text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth; yet they have not prevailed against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plowers plowed upon my back; they made long their furrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is righteous; he has cut asunder the cords of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those that hate Zion shall all be confounded and turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be as the grass upon the housetops, which withers before it grows up,
speaker: Narrator

text: with which the reaper does not fill his hand nor he that binds sheaves his bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither did those who go by say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you; we bless you in the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the depths I cry unto thee, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, hear my voice; let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou, O LORD, should mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall endure?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore there is forgiveness close to thee, that thou may be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have waited for the LORD, my soul has waited, and for his word I have waited.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul has waited for the Lord more than those that watch for the morning: I say, more than those that watch for the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel wait for the LORD; for with the LORD there is mercy and plenteous redemption close to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall ransom Israel from all his sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, my heart has not become haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; neither have I walked in grandeur, nor in wonderful things above and beyond that which pertains to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather I have quieted myself and caused my soul to become silent, that I might be as a child that is weaned of his mother, as one who is weaned from my own life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel wait for the LORD from now on and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, remember David and all his afflictions:
speaker: Narrator

text: How he swore unto the LORD and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;
speaker: Narrator

text: surely I will not come into the habitation of my house nor go up into my bed,
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not give sleep to my eyes or slumber to my eyelids,
speaker: Narrator

text: until I find out a place for the LORD, a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, we heard of her in Ephratah; we found her in the fields of the wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will go into his tents; we will worship at his footstool.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy priests are clothed with righteousness, and thy merciful ones shout for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of thy slave David, do not turn away thy face from thine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has sworn truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body I will set upon thy throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy sons will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their sons shall also sit upon thy throne for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD has chosen Zion; he has desired her for his habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be my rest for ever; here I will dwell; for I have desired her.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her poor with bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also clothe her priests with saving health, and her merciful ones shall shout aloud for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will I make the horn of David to bud; I have ordained a lamp for my anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: His enemies I will clothe with shame, but upon himself shall his crown blossom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that runs down upon the beard, even Aaron’s beard, that goes down to the skirts of his garments;
speaker: Narrator

text: as the dew of Hermon, that descends upon the mountains of Zion; for there the LORD commands blessing and eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, bless ye the LORD, all ye slaves of the LORD, who by night stand in the house of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD that made the heavens and the earth bless thee out of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. Praise ye the name of the LORD; praise him, O ye slaves of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God,
speaker: Narrator

text: praise JAH; for the LORD is good; sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For JAH has chosen Jacob unto himself and Israel for his own possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that the LORD is great and that our Lord is above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever the LORD desired, he did in the heavens and in the earth, in the seas and in all the deep places.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who causes the clouds to ascend from the ends of the earth, made the lightnings in the rain; he who brings the winds out of his treasuries.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast;
speaker: Narrator

text: sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who smote many Gentiles and slew mighty kings,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sihon king of the Amorites and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan
speaker: Narrator

text: gave their land for a heritage, a heritage unto Israel his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy name, O LORD, is eternal, and thy memorial, O LORD, from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have a mouth, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;
speaker: Narrator

text: they have ears, but they do not hear; neither is there any spirit in their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those that make them become like unto them and every one that trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the LORD, O house of Israel; bless the LORD, O house of Aaron:
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless the LORD, O house of Levi; ye that fear the LORD, bless the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion who dwells at Jerusalem. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the God of gods, for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the only one who does great wonders: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him that by intelligence made the heavens: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him that made the great lights: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun to rule in the day: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: The moon and stars to rule in the night: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: With a strong hand and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him who divided the Red Sea into parts: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him who led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him who smote great kings: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And slew powerful kings: for his mercy endures for ever,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And gave their land for an inheritance: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: Even an inheritance unto Israel his slave: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endures for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: And has redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who gives food to all flesh: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks unto the God of the heavens: for his mercy endures for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof;
speaker: Narrator

text: when there, those that carried us away captive asked us for the words of the song; with our harps of joy hung upon the willows saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: How shall we sing the song of the LORD in the land of strangers?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, my right hand shall be forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I do not remember thee, my tongue shall cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I do not prefer to lift up Jerusalem as my chief joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, O LORD, the sons of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Raze it, raze it, even to the foundation thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewards thee as thou hast served us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy shall he be, that takes and dashes thy offspring against the stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods I will sing praises unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will worship the temple of thy holiness and praise thy name above thy mercy and thy truth; for thou hast made thy name to be magnificent and raised up thy spoken word above all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day when I called, thou didst answer me and strengthen me with strength in my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, when they hearken unto the spoken words from thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD: for great is the glory of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD, who is high and lifted up, looks upon the humble, but the proud he does not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me; thou shalt stretch forth thy hand against the wrath of my enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will perfect that which concerns me; thy mercy, O LORD, endures for ever; forsake not the works of thine own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, thou hast searched me and known me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou knowest my sitting down and my rising up, thou dost understand my thoughts from afar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast girded my walk and my rest, and hast prepared all my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the word is not even upon my tongue, and, behold, O LORD, thou dost know it altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast formed my face and my insides and laid thine hand upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy knowledge is wonderful beyond my ability to comprehend; it is high, I cannot understand it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where shall I go from thy spirit? or where shall I flee from thy presence?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I ascend to the heavens, thou art there: if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, thou art there.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I take the wings of the dawn and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall shine because of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the darkness does not hide from thee; but the night shines as the day; the darkness is as the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast possessed my kidneys: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; marvellous are thy works, and that, my soul knows right well.
speaker: Narrator

text: My body was not hid from thee, even though I was made in secret and brought together in the lowest parts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes did see my substance yet being imperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which were then formed, without lacking one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, how precious are thy thoughts unto me, O God! How great is the sum of them!
speaker: Narrator

text: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand; when I awake, I am still with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God; depart from me therefore, ye bloodthirsty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do I not hate all those, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Search me, O God, and know my heart; try me and know my thoughts
speaker: Narrator

text: and see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way eternal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man; preserve me from the man of violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who devise evil in their heart; they are continually gathered together for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent; adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the man of violence, who have purposed to overthrow my steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have hid a snare for me and cords; they have spread a net; on the path they have set snares for me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said unto the LORD, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my saving health, cover thou my head in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; do not further his wicked thought lest they exalt themselves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the head of those that compass me about, let the perversion of their own lips cover them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the fire, into deep pits, that they not rise up again.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man with an evil tongue shall not be established in the earth; evil shall hunt the man of violence to overthrow him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that the LORD will effect the judgment of the poor and the judgment of the destitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name; the upright shall dwell in thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, I have called unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense, the gift of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set a watch, O LORD, upon my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to do works with ungodliness with the men that work iniquity, and let me not eat of their dainties.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the righteous smite me in mercy, and let him reprove me: and let not a flattering evil prince anoint my head, for my prayer shall ever be against his evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their judges shall be thrown down from strong places; they shall hearken unto my words; for they are sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol, as when one cuts and cleaves wood upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore mine eyes look unto thee, O GOD the Lord; in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me from the hands of the snare which they have laid for me, and from the snares of the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wicked fall together into their own nets, whilst I pass on ahead forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall cry unto the LORD with my voice; with my voice shall I ask the LORD for mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall pour out my complaint before him; before him I shall tell of my trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou didst know my path. In the way in which I walked have they secretly laid a snare for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no one that would know me; I had no refuge; no one cared for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried unto thee, O LORD; I said, Thou art my hope and my portion in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attend unto my cry, for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name; the righteous shall feast with me; when thou shalt have weaned me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O LORD; give ear to my supplications for the sake of thy truth; answer me for the sake of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And enter not into judgment with thy slave; for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has smitten my life down to the ground; he has made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my spirit has become overwhelmed within me; my heart within me has become desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remembered the days of old; I meditated on all thy works; I mused on the work of thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I stretched forth my hands unto thee; my soul thirsted after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me speedily, O LORD; my spirit fails; hide not thy face from me lest I be like those that go down into the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to hear thy mercy in the morning, for in thee do I trust; cause me to know the way in which I should walk, for I lift up my soul unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, O LORD, from my enemies; I flee unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me to do thy will, for thou art my God. Let thy good Spirit lead me into the land of uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: By thy name, O LORD, thou shalt give me life; by thy righteousness thou shalt bring my soul out of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by thy mercy thou shalt scatter my enemies and destroy all the adversaries of my soul; for I am thy slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the LORD my strength, who trains my hands for the battle and my fingers for the war:
speaker: Narrator

text: My mercy and my fortress; my high tower and my deliverer; my shield and he in whom I trust, who subdues my people under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, what is man that thou knowest him? or the son of man, that thou esteemeth him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Man is like unto vanity; his days are as a shadow that passes away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast forth lightning and scatter them; shoot out thine arrows and destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send thine hand from above; redeem me and deliver me out of many waters, from the hand of the strange sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose mouth speaks vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God; upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, he who gives salvation unto kings, who redeems David his slave from the evil sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Redeem me, and save me from the hand of strange sons, whose mouth speaks vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:
speaker: Narrator

text: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace;
speaker: Narrator

text: that our garners may be full, affording all manner of store; that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets;
speaker: Narrator

text: that our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in nor going out; that there be no shout of alarm in our streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that people, that is in such a case; yea, blessed is that people, whose God is the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will extol thee, my God, my king, and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each day will I bless thee, and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is the LORD and greatly to be praised, and his greatness is unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text: One generation shall praise thy works to another and shall declare thy mighty acts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will speak of the beauty of the glory of thy majesty and of thy wondrous works.
speaker: Narrator

text: And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts, and I will declare thy greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall proclaim the memory of thy great goodness and shall sing of thy righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger and of great mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is good to all; and his tender mercies shine over all his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all thy works praise thee, O LORD, and thy merciful ones bless thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: They speak of the glory of thy kingdom and talk of thy power,
speaker: Narrator

text: to make known to the sons of Adam his mighty acts and the glory of the magnificence of his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages, and thy dominion endures throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD upholds all that fall and raises up all those that are oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of all wait upon thee, and thou givest them their food in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou dost open thine hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is righteous in all his ways and merciful in all his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is near unto all those that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will fulfil the desire of those that fear him; he also will hear their cry and will save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD preserves all those that love him, but all the wicked he will destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD, and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. Praise the LORD, O my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my life I will praise the LORD; I will sing praises unto my God while I live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man in whom there is no salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: His spirit shall go forth, he shall return to his earth; in that very day all his thoughts shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God;
speaker: Narrator

text: who made the heavens and the earth, the sea and all that is therein; who keeps truth for ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: He who does justice unto the oppressed; who gives bread to the hungry. The LORD looses the prisoners:
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD opens the eyes of the blind; the LORD raises those that are bowed down; the LORD loves the righteous:
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD preserves the strangers; he raises up the fatherless and widow; but the way of the wicked he turns upside down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, from generation to generation. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for praise is pleasant and beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD, he who builds up Jerusalem; shall gather together the outcasts of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He heals the broken hearted, and he binds up their wounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: He counts the number of the stars and calls them all by their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is our Lord and of great power; his intelligence is infinite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD lifts up the humble; he casts the wicked down to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who covers the heavens with clouds, who prepares the rain for the earth, who makes grass to grow upon the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who gives the beast his food and to the sons of the ravens which cry unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He does not delight in the strength of the horse; nor does he take pleasure in the legs of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD takes pleasure in those that fear him, in those that wait upon his mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has strengthened the bars of thy gates; he has blessed thy sons within thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who makes peace to be thy borders shall fill thee with the finest of the wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sends forth his word upon earth; his word runs very swiftly.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who gives snow like wool scatters the hoarfrost like ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He casts forth his ice like morsels; who can stand before his cold?
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall send forth his word and melt them; his wind shall blow, and the waters shall flow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He declares his words unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has not dealt so with the other nations, which have not known his judgments. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. Praise ye the LORD from the heavens; praise him in the heights.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him, all his angels; praise ye him, all his hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise ye him, sun and moon; praise him, all ye stars of light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens and ye waters that are above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the name of the LORD; for he commanded, and they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has established them for ever and ever: he has made a law which shall not be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the LORD from the earth, ye dragons and all deeps,
speaker: Narrator

text: fire and hail; snow and vapour; stormy wind fulfilling his word,
speaker: Narrator

text: mountains and all hills; fruitful trees and all cedars,
speaker: Narrator

text: beasts and all animals; creeping things and flying fowl,
speaker: Narrator

text: kings of the earth and all the peoples, princes and all judges of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: both young men and maidens, the old with the children,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the name of the LORD; for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above earth and heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: has exalted the horn of his people; let all his merciful ones praise him; even of the sons of Israel, the people near unto him. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. Sing unto the LORD a new song, let his praise be in the congregation of the merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel rejoice with his Maker; let the sons of Zion be joyful with their King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise his name in the dance; let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD takes pleasure in his people; he will beautify the humble with saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: The merciful shall be joyful with glory; they shall sing aloud upon their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high praises of God shall be in their mouth and a two-edged sword in their hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: to execute vengeance upon the Gentiles and punishments upon the peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text: to imprison their kings with fetters and their nobles with chains of iron,
speaker: Narrator

text: to execute upon them the judgment written: this shall be glory for all his merciful ones. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halelu-JAH. Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in the firmament of his power.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise him for his mighty acts; praise him according to his excellent greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise him with the sound of the shofar; praise him with the psaltery and harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise him with the timbrel and dance; praise him with stringed instruments and organs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise him upon the loud cymbals; praise him upon the cymbals of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let every thing that has breath praise JAH. Halelu-JAH.
speaker: Narrator
